text: The food was excellent, friendly quick service.  The dining area was pleasant.  I had the beef sandwich, monster fries and a vanilla shake which were all delicious!

This place is awesome! My newly vegan husband and I were so happy to find this place. Everything we tried was absolutely delicious. The fried zucchini, curly fries, burgers, and popcorn chicken were divine. We pigged out! Even if you're not vegan or vegetarian, you should try it!

Update: just reading threw some of these reviews it's insain that some people find the need to nit pick this place for every last detail! Seriously people complaining about not having a big enough onion on their burger ?? R u kidding me ! People not used to vegan cheese saying it tastes funny, complaining about it being busy ??its the 1st vegan drive thru in Vegas hellloo  it's going to be busy. Can people leave constructive critisism? ....having an opinion  is one thing but knocking a place that's promoting compassion to animals that's just asking for bad karma. Seriously let's appreciate the fact that we have a vegan drive thru in our city....if u dont like Vegeway take your wining to McDonalds! 

And fyi... The burgers are freakin bomb here! Chef Kenny is bomb, and the customer service was bomb!

Had the popcorn chicken (YUM!). It was even better cold. 
Had the chicken wrap. DELICIOUS 
Had a chocolate shake. Worth it!

PROS... Hallelujah for a vegan drive thru in Vegas.  Friendly staff but didn't get all the sauces we requested.

The popcorn chicken's texture is good (don't expect it to taste a lot like chicken...as with the burger & any vegan substitute.)  The breading on it is a great texture, like tempura but not quite as light.  

The meat sandwich is pretty good, especially the yummy fixins and sauce.

NOT actual cons but not pros... Chocolate shake is barely sweet and pretty watery but has a pretty good flavor.  More sweetness would bring out the chocolate flavor more.  

The zucchini breading is tempura like, a wonderful texture, but like the chicken & burger, the ranch dressing, & much of the food here, it falls under the unfortunate and unnecessary vegan stereotype of bland or not enough flavor. There are many who make vegan taste good, this place, not so much.

Not fast veggie food. Not the best service!! Ordered something through drive through and they gave me a total. Drove up to window and proceeded to wait 13 minutes and no one came to the window or noticed me at all. After that I honked and waived to get their attention and after 2 minutes some guy came and said "what do your Want" really. I told him that I've been waiting for aver 10 minutes he said "I just got here so I don't know what you ordered." No one else inside knew either. Come on. I was really looking forward to giving this place a try! Sad

Love the food.  Just not so keen about the prices.  The sizes of the shakes have been downsized since opening day, while the prices hasn't.  Drive thru is extremely slow, faster to park and go inside to order.  Small (maybe about 10 tables) so gets extremely crowded when busy.

Now that I've tried almost everything on the menu, I feel fairly qualified to write a review that may help the Vegeway newbie out, and maybe even the owner, as there are just a couple of tweaks that would make this place a solid 5 stars. To make it more readable, I'll divide by category:

The excellent: 1. Beef sandwich. This is reminiscent of a banh mi sandwich; light, yet filling, slightly sweet and spicy, and refreshing from the cilantro and shredded carrot. This is my favorite item on the entire menu. 2. Chocolate shake. No one would be able to tell this isn't a regular chocolate shake. Perfect texture and chocolaty-ness. 

The very good: 1. Cheeseburger. Yep this satisfies all the cravings for cheesy, decadent, filling, and "meaty". It would have been excellent except the cheese isn't quite there. It has a slightly plastic/fake flavor. I know vegan cheese is tricky but I've had better. 2. Vanilla shake. It ain't no chocolate shake but perfect texture. I can tell this is a nondairy milkshake which is fine, but you won't fool anyone with it. 3. Chicken wrap. This was much bigger than I expected, it looks and feels like a huge 5-pound burrito. I'm not sure if it's supposed to be served hot or cold because it looked like it was grilled yet when I took a bite it was room temperature and the tortilla seemed slightly stale. Still, this is another dish that will satisfy that comfort food craving. 

Room for improvement: 1. Fries. I tried both sweet potato and regular fries on two different days and they were soggy both times. There is just no excuse for soggy fries and instead of them being a delicious accompaniment to your sandwich they're just a pile of disappointment. Please Vegeway, fix this and I'll come more often. 
2. The Cajun sauce. So much potential but not executed well. Not enough zip or flavor. Sauces are easy, come on guys. 3. Strawberry shake. Strawberry shakes can either be amazing or just taste off. Unfortunately this tasted off. Just no. 4. Popcorn chicken. Not terrible but it just tastes like fried balls of dough. I couldn't really discern where the outside ended and the inside began. Nothing "chicken-y" about it in my opinion, but if you like eating anything fried and don't really care what it is, this may be for you.  

I also have to add that the customer service is excellent. Always an enthusiastic greeting when you're coming and going. They'll help you choose what to get and everyone is very friendly. There are a handful of tables but it gets crowded at lunch on the weekend, but I can't vouch for other times. I live about 30 minutes away but I will definitely be back. They've hit on a niche market and they've just about hit a grand slam. Go and see for yourself, and I guarantee you'll be back for more.

Really enjoyed this place! Excellent food, customer service, and a very friendly staff. The Beef sandwich and popcorn chicken are outstanding. They have a special shake now for the holidays called made with peanut and white chocolate which is delicious.

Veggie House is overpriced. VegeWay is overpriced. 

Chef Kenny doesn't care to talk to you if you do not resemble someone he's met in the past as an acquaintance or friend or one who is likely to be a member of Yelp. If you are Caucasian with a North Face jacket on and sporting some horn-rimmed Oliver Peoples glasses, then yes, he will banter with you, but if you are Chinese and from a remote mountain village, then expect to be ignored and denied free samples.

But that was Veggie House. That was then, this is now. I will review VegeWay as VegeWay.

Do not order the hamburger. The patty is dry and the cheese, being vegan, tastes like Elmer's glue. The bun may not be Devonshire butter brioche, but it is an insubstantial mess.

The beef sandwich, an obvious take on the Vietnamese-style banh mi is a poor clone of the iconic sandwich. It isn't freshly baked French bread, but store-bought hoagie. The beef consists of diced pieces of dried soy jerky. For the price here ($6.50 or so) you can get 2 authentic banh mi sandwiches at a Vietnamese bakery.

The fried finger foods are mediocre, but proudly presented as vegan. Enjoy.

I do like the place at night, however, as it resembles one of those retro burger dives one would see still operating in places like Flint, Michigan, but with cheerful employees in their plant-based colored uniforms.

Verdict: Overpriced and mediocre
Amazing food and products and super fast!! The 'chicken nuggets' were a bit boring with no flavor but the burger and chicken wrap were amazing! And decent prices as well! definitely going back :)

I ordered the zucchini fries with ranch, which were crispy and delicious! I wasn't a fan of the ranch dip, but the zucchini was tasty!
My husband ordered a double-patty 'cheeseburger' and curly fries, which I stole a bite of, and was very flavorful with a good texture! I was told this place was like 'In N Out' only vegan, but I would say its more of just a fast-food style burger joint. The food came out quickly, the curly fries were crispy and flavorful, and everything was piping hot. I highly recommend trying their food!

This is our spot! Great tasting food, drive-thru, and vegan! My wife and I love Vegeway. We live nearby, and it quickly became one of our favorite places to go to when eating out. We've had the menu, minus the tacos, and it has all tasted delicious. The popcorn chicken with curly fries is my go-to order! Though sometimes I deviate and get a beef sandwhich :").

Thanks to Chef Kenny for briging this concept to fruition.

OH. MY. GOODNESS...  I have found my happy place, seriously!!  First off, the place itself: They sell the most awesome vegan stickers, which I urge you to check out!  Secondly, the staff here seems far happier than the staffs at any nonvegan restaurant, go figure! Always friendly, cheerful, helpful, and genuinely passionate about the meals they serve, which brings me to the food!  Everything I've tried here has been fantastic!  Like a vegan In-n-Out with more options, I loved the animal fries!  That's right, vegan sauce and vegan cheese (not a huge fan of Daiya, but it was still great! Learning to like it), and grilled onions over french fries.  YUM!  My favorite, however, was the chicken ranch sandwich, which was exquisite!  Definitely have a weakness for ranch, so thank goodness for vegan ranch!  Another gem on the menu is the chocolate peanut butter milkshake!  Oh man, I didn't think I'd ever have a good milkshake again after going vegan, so a big THANK YOU to VegeWay for proving me wrong on that thought.  I've also tried a few other things on the menu, like their double cheeseburger and their chicken poppers, which were equally delicious.  I consider myself a big fan.  Fast food has never felt better, or tastier.  My only complaint, hence the four stars (If I could only remove a half star I would have done that) was that on one occasion that I was dining here, the TV was set to a Food Network type cooking show (not sure what show exactly, not big on watching TV), which was displaying the preparation of a steak.  I found that to be bothersome, since I was eating in a vegan establishment.  It was a bit hard to eat and maintain an appetite while watching cow flesh being cut apart and prepared :/  However, in terms of everything else, Five Stars easy!!
Omg. This burger is the best! I've been waiting this since stopping beef two years ago. So good. The cheese and sauce was perfect too. Love love love it.

It was okay. Ordered burgers. Only tomato, patty, onion, and either cheese? Or sauce? Hard to say. Anyway, service was fast. Took our order on a notebook. Burgers smashed to the bottom. They look nothing like photos. And also had sweet potato fries. Good but the darker ones tasted very bad. I just wish they let me know that the burgers were somewhat spicy, certain bites of it. Maybe the seasoning? Although I didn't mind, my 5 yo son threw up. He was unable to eat it. Had I known I would've ordered something else for him. I felt it was a bit pricey for what we received. Taste was...okay.

Not that great. 
It was really fun to try a vegan fast food, but honestly, the best thing we had was the milkshake. Too bad the mango was discontinued. Anyway, the burger is super average. Even grocery store burgers are better since they have some flavor and more texture. Kinda surprised the bun isn't an obvious whole grain or wheat. Overall, flavor really lacked. Kids enjoyed the fries, but they will eat those anywhere. Zucchini would be better if it was seasoned, its pretty bland, but the breading is great. Same goes for the popcorn chicken. There are enough vegan options in Vegas that we won't be back. On an upside, we loved that the staff clearly love their jobs. They were singing in the kitchen and obviously happy. That was nice to see and hear.
Everyone needs to come eat here ! The white chocolate peanut butter shake is amazing . The vegan burgers , taste like in and out! Nom nom

Ordered 1 burger and 1 fries through the drive thru. Sat at the window for about 30 minutes waiting and waiting and waiting. Finally came inside to see what was going on with my order  and there were at least 6 employees in there and one customer. I told them I had been sitting at the drive thru waiting and the girl at the counter asked me what my order number was. How would I know??? I've been sitting outside for almost half an hour waiting to be acknowledged. I then noticed my food just sitting at the corner. They handed it to me with no apologies, no anything. I really like this place and unfortunately I won't be back nor recommending it to anyone.

Food is great but service leaves a lot to be desired. If it's your first time going I recommend going in down time because it seems if there are more than 2 or 3 other groups/customers the staff can't handle it. This is the second time I've ordered vegan burgers without cheeze and have gotten cheeze both times. This time the person taking my order didn't repeat it back to me and rushed me through it, and of course things are wrong. Stop by if you don't see any cars in the drive-thru or customers in line.

Great vegan food, but the young people behind the counter keep the gangster rap, hip-hop, grunge metal, and punk-rock music turned up so loud that it ruins the dining experience.  I suggest the drive thru.
Yummy! I wish they open another location around Trop n 215. We probably go more often.

A very enjoyable experience where the staff are smiling and the food is wonderful.
We ordered two different types of meals with fries and the fried zucchini. I am not a huge fried food fan, but this really hit the spot for sure! The fried are freshly made also.
Good on ya for having a vegan fast food restaurant.
I LOVE this place! Everything is delicious and my non-vegan friends are addicted! Will definitely be back soon!

Drive through takes 8 minutes per vehicle. I have waited 28 minutes with 3 vehicles in front of me at the S Jones Las Vegas location. 
I observed one of the female employee's scoop ice cream and proceed to push the ice cream into the blender with her index finger multiple times with no food prep gloves on. Sanitation in the kitchen appears dirty from the drive through window. The female employee's all look like they are wearing fitness pants and have no hairnet's, aprons, food prep gloves when preparing shakes, and are often preoccupied with talking about what appears to be non work related stories. This all adds to the increased wait time customers can expect at the S Jones Las Vegas location.
The food is decent. Although they uses frozen packaged food for fried menu options - e.g., curly and regular fries, orange chicken, ext. Vegan but not healthy in my honest opinion.

So unbelievably delicious! The popcorn chicken doesn't need any sauce... you can't stop eating it! The milkshakes are the best I've had! The wait is long... be prepared but it also speaks volumes about their food. Long overdue and WORTH IT

BEST VEGAN BURGER! The double burger was great. Personally im not a fan of the cheese but everything else was great! If your a picky eater i would order the burger with no cheese and sauce on the side :)

Wow - I'm not vegetarian but I'd be vegan everyday if I had access to this place where I currently live! A friend and I stopped in for some fast food during our Vegas trip and wow, just wow. The Hawaiian burger with sweet potato fries were amazing. So flavorful, healthy and delicious! You wouldn't even know you were eating vegan. My friend had a vegan milkshake and she said it was the best milkshake she'd ever eaten. Can this place become a chain so I can eat there in Texas??? Props go to Chef Kenny, what a nice guy who knows his way around the kitchen!
This place is amazing. Worth a cab ride off the strip, some of the best vegan fast food I've ever had.
Amazing! Small menu but done well. Banh no was amazing and the Hawaiian burger was fabulous! Plus the Groupon was a deal!!

Fist time here , I must say it could of been better, I take ONE star off because my chicken wrap was COLD , I mean everything in that wrap was cold it didn't taste good at all , beside that, my experience was good the girls working there had great costumer service.
Vegan Drive thru, milkshake and burger, dank as no other. Better then any fast-food joint you can find. If you are going through Vegas worth the stop!!

A vegan version of In-and-Out. The burgers are amazing!!! Indescribably delicious. I prefer them without cheese because they use Daiya cheese (not my favorite), but aside from that just utterly tasty and yummy. I usually eat 2 though could easily eat 3. And, the burgers go great with the curly fries.

But, as good as the burgers and fries are, the milkshakes are the BEST. Absolutely the best vegan milkshake around. Chocolate is my favorite and each time I go it seems to be the favorite of most people who are in there as well.

Sooo good and even meat eaters will like it.

2 stars because this is an easy vegan meal that's fast. But the food: I had the cheeseburger and it was so bland I had to load it with ranch, but that too was bland. The curly fries tasted like Arby's, good but had higher expectations. The zucchini was terrible and bland. The popcorn chicken was thrown out after one bite. I wouldn't choose this place again, very greasy (I know it's fast food) but way greasier than average in n out. Worth a try, but not anything special. Has so much potential if they learn how to use some seasoning.

The vegan popcorn chicken bites were very good. This place surprised me in a great way. I didn't know meatless meat could taste so good and have such a good texture. Warning though on the burgers, if you've never had vegan cheese just know it doesn't taste like cheese. It has a completely different flavor. I like the burger much better without it! The service was great too.

All hail Chef Kenny! He did it again with VegeWay! Finally a fast food restaurant for Vegans! He brought the amazing salads from his other restaurant. The burgers, fries and dairy free milkshakes are the best. You don't even realize they are meat free. But Chef, when are you gonna open something for the Vegans in Henderson?!?!
Sign on the door says they close at 9pm, website says they close at 9pm, even Google says they close at 9pm. Then why are they closed at 8:30? Not a good business practice.

This place is a vegan's paradise. The burgers are comparable to those being churned out at some of America's most well-known fast-food chains, and I have no problem saying the fries (especially the recently introduced "monster fries", which are a vegan spin on a popular competitors' "animal style fries") are better than any other fast-food joint. Everyone working here obviously enjoys their job, as my girlfriend and I have never dealt with a snappy employee. We're slowly becoming regulars here and we have absolutely no issues with that! Vegeway: transcendental idea; flawless execution.

This is the spot for a yummy fast food experience. I'm not vegan (but considering a shift) and I still enjoyed the burger and banh mi. They are thinking carefully about flavor and texture at VegWay and I appreciate it. I'd suggest that new customers: 1) arrive at an off time, 2) try everything,  and 3) share it with an open-minded friend. It's not healthy food, but it's so yummy and it's nice to have a fast food option that doesn't include animal protein. 

Yes, there were issues with mistakes in people's orders (60% of the orders while we were there).

Yes, the food output was slow.

But I still can't wait to return. The food was delicious (I want that "milk"shake recipe NOW), the cashier was incredibly warm and helpful, and the cook came over and talked to us about the food. He took immense pride at having prepared it. 

My biggest complaint is that I have to drive so far to get there. I am a fan.

A drive-thru vegan restaurant? Not only is the food here amazing, it comes out so fast. The nice lady who took our order was very patient and accommodating. The Vegan Beef Sandwich was one of the best Banh Mi I've ever tasted. Everything here is good and you don't even have to get out of your car. Can't wait to come back!
The popcorn chicken was chewy, and the fries were cold. The wrap I got was really more like a burrito. I was quite confused by it all, and I'm vegan.

Everything I had here was incredibly delicious. I would love to have a single "con" about the place or the food but I just don't. 
I brought my friend who is a carnivore here, and he completely loved the food and I quote "If every vegan dish tasted like this, I don't think anybody would have a problem going vegan" 

The food is extremely delicious. I long for the weekends when I can pig out on their goodness. 

My favorite dishes to date: 
1- Steak Sandwich (you may choose to get without jalapenos...it is a bit too hot,but delicious) 
2- VegeWay Burger  - PHENOMENAL, blows anything you had labeled "veggie burger" out of the water, the texture and flavor is just right. 
3- Orange Popcorn Chicken - Tastes just like the "real thing", I bring it home and eat it with rice to relive my Chinese food days. 


God bless this place, and I hope people get to find out about it, since I stumbled across it by mistake online.
Food was amazing. Service was fantastic. Best milk shake of my life. And all of this from a non vegan.

Just visiting Las Vegas, Vege-Way was a welcome meal!  It was easy to get to, but looked like a new development so I hope they get enough business!! The meal was everything it should've been!  I had a banh mi sandwich (they called it vegan beef sandwich....but it was vegan banh mi!) with sweet potato fries and my hubby had a Hawaiian burger and fried zucchini (tempura style I think!).  All of it was delicious!  Simple food, tasty, vegan & I didn't have to make it!!  Sometimes you want fast food and not have to spend an hour describing how to modify it!   I will make this a regular stop when I'm in town.

I have been here a few times because it's close to my house and I don't feel as guilty as I would going to another fast food joint. The service and food is usually so good! Today I came in and while I was waiting for my food I noticed the workers wearing gloves. First thought "awesome! good for you vegeway!" But then I watch this food handler take out his cell phone, use it and then go back to handling food while wearing the same gloves. I also watched him use the register while wearing gloves. GROSS! Management should take time out and explain the importance of food sanitation and safety to their staff. 

Vegeway also changed the fries to a thinner cut fries that aren't nearly as good as the old ones. I don't know if they're cutting back on portions but the fries I received with my meal only filled about half of my basket when it used to be overflow. 

I don't know if I will return based on the glove issue alone and I probably wouldn't spend the extra to get a meal if my fries are only going to be filled half way and taste generic.

I ordered the Double Vegan Burger. It was okay. The cheese isn't the type of vegan cheese I eat. I prefer Chao cheese as it doesn't taste as fake as other brands. The burger fell apart when eating it so I eventually gave up. I would try this place again and maybe order something different such as the regular vegan burger and see if they have different vegan cheese.

I tried this place out with pretty high expectations. I wouldn't say that it was a disappointment, but considering the circumstances, I probably wouldn't come back here. For one, the drive is very far from my house and the food wasn't necessarily worth it. The service wasn't the best; we waited quite a long time for the food, and there weren't a lot of people in the restaurant. The staff wasn't the nicest, either, BUT...I only went one time. They could've just had an off-day. The burgers were personally not my favorite, but the chicken was amazing. I also loved the fries and the vanilla shake.

We visit Las Vegas pretty much annually and always eat at Veggie House, usually twice.  While there we saw the ad for this place.

Visited on a Sunday at noon; was somewhat surprised to see Chef Kenny in attendance working the kitchen.  

Was so good, we went back the next day.  Between our group we tried the burger, fish taco, beef sandwich, regular fries, curly fries and zucchini fries.  Everything was superb.  Particularly the beef sandwich which was very similar to a bahn mi.

Lots of the menu is fried and all was a  little greasy.  I'm unsure how healthy this is but like any fast food place, it should be more like a treat and not a daily source of nourishment.  Vegan fast food is an interesting concept and not only do I wish Chef Kenny well in this endeavor, I'm looking forward to going back next year.

Absolutely delicious!!!!     My partner had the double cheese burger just as I did. He had a mango shake which was sweet, but not overly sweet. The shake was smooth, silky... and just fabulous!  We also had zucchini and sweet potatoes...they were good, but nothing out of the ordinary. The main star, the burgers, were THE BEST VEGAN burgers that I have ever eaten ...I have been a vegetarian for 22 years.   I know that VegeWay is brand new (I showed up on the 2nd and 4th day)...so the drive through was a little bit slow. However, I have worked in restaurants in the past and know that when one opens a new place, it takes a good week to iron out the kinks. So, I didn't factor that into my review.  I will be taking meat-eatering family to VegeWay!

Vegans, heed my word: Las Vegas ain't no California. Do not expect a vegan option or two on the menu of every restaurant you walk into. Hence my excitement upon hearing that there's a new all-vegan restaurant in town. First thought upon entering the joint: "I can eat ANYTHING on the menu!" I was so overwhelmed by this prospect that I did what any sensible consumer would do: asked the staff for their favorite/most popular item. The Hawaiian burger and curly fries were it, apparently. I got the burger... and was profoundly disappointed.  It dripped fat and lacked flavor. Fake cheese made exactly zero contribution to it. This particular burger deserves two, not three stars, but the extra star I'm giving this establishment represents the benefit of the doubt: maybe I got the wrong item. I am willing to give this place one more try before I make up my mind. Expect an update.
so much yes for all vegan fast food place. Service was fast, food was good, totally will come back and recommend this place to anyone!

I came here when they first opened and I remember thinking it wasn't that good. Came back today and WOW!! I'm so glad I came back! Everything was so delicious. Had the cheeseburger, popcorn chicken, curly fries and a milkshake! Highly recommend !!

Thus far I'm very happy with the options and quality which VegeWay has to offer. I have been a pescatarian for 11 years, and normally resign to a grilled cheese if I'm with a friend that wants In-n-out (which I'm fine with, being a cheese-aholic). Recently, I gave up cheese as a slow process of cutting dairy out of my diet, and it has been a rough go. I found out about this place but was skeptical, because I didn't think it could be THAT good (I'm normally not a fan of 'vegan cheese') but I'm very happy to say that I was DEAD WRONG. I ordered the single patty combo with curly fries, upgraded to a strawberry vegan milkshake (amazeballs), and a side of vegan popcorn chicken with all the vegan sauces they had. Everything is delicious and I'm very happy to recommend this spot to any and all of my vegetarian and vegan friends struggling to just find a quick fix every once in a while. I could honestly go on and on but I'm just going to go back to my awesome meal and frequent this spot often. Don't be shy! Give it a try!

Ive been vegan for almost 4 months now and this place is really good. I always get the "burger only" and it always hits the spot. But today, i had a bad experience. I decided to try out theyre orange chicken and it was very unpleasant. First off, ive had many "chikn" alternative, the texture is almost like baked potatoes, easy to chew, not grainy and very moist texture. This orange chicken i was eating from their establishment was grainy and tough i had to yank my teeth away each bite i took. Finally, taking a big bite of one of the bits, a string of -watever the fuck - was unchewable, having me to spit it out. Idk if that was a vein or wat but it was discusting. If this was a soy product, this would not have happened. And the orange chicken sauce is gross. Its very bland barely sweet. Dont think i will return, now i feel like this not a real plant based establishment. And im starting to think their dressing and shakes are also made with dairy product.

Fried zucchini and the Hawaiian burger are my absolute favorite. I love the ranch here too. I've been to a few vegan spots in town that served burgers and no one can't  top VegeWay. If your looking for good clean vegan food, come check them out!
Best vegan burger I have ever had! Zucchini strips excellent too.  Now two great restaurants from Chef K.  Thanks for brining such excellent vegan food to us.

Vegans/vegetarians who haven't been plant based long enough to still have an occasional hankering for In-N-Out, you just found your Shangri-La. The famous In-N-Out burger is expertly replicated into an animal/earth friendly delight at Vege Way. From what I remember about In-N-Out, this version actually tastes better (perhaps that's owing to the fact that it is cruelty free). Cheese was some of the closest plant based version of a good ol' slab of greasy American cheese that I've ever tasted. 

Just a few critiques of the place: part of what tops off the In-N-Out experience was the fries. While tasty, the fries at Vege Way are not close to the original. It would be nice if the fries were replicated as well. Also, a vegan offering similar to In-N-Out's animal style dressing would be a welcome option. Additionally service was very slow and many orders seemed to be messed up, but I'm chocking that up to them having been open 2 days when I was there.

All in all, I will definitely be returning many times, I'm sure.
Love the fish taco cilantro salad Hawaiian burger strawberry shake and reg fries! Love how there's always new items to try!! Would suggest to have rice bowls!

We were passing through Vegas on the way home from Utah and had to check this place out.  I ordered a Double Vegan Cheeseburger meal and my companion had a Chicken Ranch sandwich that was not on the regular menu.  My burger was good but really messy.  I also wish I had ordered a single instead of a double but my eyes are always bigger than my stomach.  The fries were good too but I was too full to eat many after that burger!  I would definitely stop again and maybe try the fish next time.
Awesome vegan food and great service. Will definately return. We ordered burgers , fries and shakes. This is definitely a great place for this community

Chef Kenny was all over the place.
Disappointing.
He was yelling on the phone right next to my table talking about his camera security issues.

Ordered 2 vegan hamburgers. Very bland where i needed to use extra sauce. We got sweet potato fries which were so greasy it was bearable to even want to eat.

While we were sitting right next to him he didn't even ask if we were okay or if we needed anything. The environment was so uncomfortable i just wanted to get out of there.

I would not recommend this place to anyone.

For me being vegetarian this place is a no go.  Everything that they serve is made with processed soy products and veggie products made to look like meat products. I'm not sure why people think that vegetarian means to simulate meat!?? Things were deep fried which I wasn't expected it to be. I would've been better off going to A regular fast food place and altering it like I usually do. BUT I'm sure a lot of X Meat eaters like this place.

The food here is phenomenal, love the burger and fries which is all I've tried so far. But the drive thru takes forever which is some what understandable since it's not really fast food that's being microwaved. My biggest problem is that that seem to ALWAYS be out of the soy-free patties and the gluten free buns. Doesn't seem to me like they're ready to be open. Because they don't have a distributor that can keep up with the demand. Now I find myself having to call ahead of time to see if they have them available :/

Second time at VegeWay. First time in the drive thru and it will be my last. Initially order was repeated incorrectly back to me. There wasn't anyone in the drive thru line, and I ended up waiting 25 mins in the drive thru! Are you catching a vegan cow!? After 25 mins they told me they are out of onions, so I have to change 2 of my items. It's 4pm, and you're out of onions? I ended up getting a refund, and no food!

Horrible food, horrible service. I brought the special sauce to the girl at register because it had a long black hair on it and she wiped it off and put it back out. Um no thanks. The staff is so young they seemed a little inexperienced and unguided. Blind leading the blind. If there was a manager or team leader it sure didn't show. I was hoping for a good experience and will not recommend for bad service and uncleanliness. Oh and the food wasn't that great for the price we paid.

This review is based on a Groupon take out order. I enjoyed the 'chicken' turmeric salad. They put the sauce on the side, so I actually didn't use it and enjoyed the salad without it. Everything was fresh and tasty. I also got the 6 burger patties, but have not tried them yet, they do look very good. One thing that was disappointing, the staff needs training, they didn't not know how to apply the Groupon, the person working my order was wearing gloves, but then touched the register,  phone, food and back and forth...never changing the gloves. Sometimes I think using gloves is worse, because people don't get that cross contamination is the problem. If they have been trained, maybe they just don't care enough to change gloves, it's too much trouble, but that is your business. I would recommend, just watch the food handling.

Like all the other reviews will say...this is literally the in-n-out for Vegans! Finally I can have a burger and fries and feel healthy but guilty afterwards! They also have other Vegan fast food items such as tacos, a chikn wrap and popcorn chikn! I highly recommend coming here. I even made it tonight at 8:50 and they still took my order even though it was going to run them past closing time! I could go on and on but just try it!

I love you Chef Kenny.....but sorry.

FrankenFood thats what hubby calls it.

I have tried and tried to like this food but its seriously one star for me. Thinking about it even gives me a "film" coating in my mouth. 

The third time I came here (today) I got the chkn wrap and seriously it weighted ten pounds. I was scared to even try it. Full of Veggie House brown rice, gooey chkn, tons of sundried tomatoes, wilty lettuce....just not good.


The burger patty is ok, but todays was dry like a hockey puck. The first time I tried one it had a melted plastic taste because of the Daiya, two more times I minus the cheese and onion and realize it just does not taste like a burger, why? no pickles. This place does not believe in pickles.

The fysh taco is good but wow its soggy and just a mess.  
The first time I tried, it had a great taste, guess I was super hungry.

Chkn bites are super gross and doughy and the "ranch" tastes like oily old dill.

Milkshakes are bomb but hey the ice cream is from Perfect Scoop. 

I did order curly fries and they taste exactly like the ones from Arby's I ate 20 years ago. Not a reason to come back.  

Just not a fan. Centennial same experience. 
And consistency is a huge issue here and at the other location!

I'm not sure what happened to this place, but I saw other reviewers had complaints recently. I came here before and thought the service and food were amazing. Today however, was different. 

I ordered in the drive thru for just a burger and curly fries. I said my order twice. I come up to the window, paid, didn't bother for a receipt, got my food and went home (which is like 5 minutes away). I take out my order and the fries were regular fries, even though I said curly. I shrugged it off. Then the bottom of my burger was cold. Not the middle, but the bun on the bottom. It had grill marks, but it was cold. Like they grilled it in the morning and put it in the fridge or something. Then, my cheese wasn't melted all the way through. Really disappointing. 

I called, after reading some reviews on here, to talk to the manager because I really liked this place. Girl who answered puts me on hold, then comes back to say the manager won't be in till 2:30. I asked for the manager's name and she said Claudia. I asked for the last name and she didn't know. Hmm... Don't know if she's being shady, but she said she'll ask. So she comes back on the phone and says Gonzalez. So I'll be calling back at 2:30 to speak to Claudia Gonzalez who I hope is the manager.

So good even my "which dish has the most meat?" husband loved it! He asked me half a dozen times if I was sure it had no meat in it.  We had Hawaiian burgers and orange chicken. Not only healthier, but the burgers are better, bigger, and, in most cases, cheaper than any "regular" fast food burger. Chef Kenny is a magician with vegan food!

The Hawaiian burger is just amazing! I love the taste and flavors of the food. Also the strawberry shake hits the spot. Just one ding for the cooks, we loved the popcorn "chicken" but majority of it was just fried batter. :/ Overall great place for vegan eats

Very good the fact that there is a vegan fast food is just amazing. The burger is where it really shines. The popcorn chicken doesn't have much flavor. Very bland. The curly fries far outshine the regular fries. The shakes are good and it's great that they use almond milk. A few tweaks and this place would be amazing. I wish you could add grilled onions to a burger and if they had some more condiments. They only had ketchup. No mustard pickles or relish. Still overall someone making the effort for a vegan fast food is Amazing and I give chef Kenny props!

I'm obsessed with Veggie House and when I found out that's Chef Kenny was opening Vege-Way I flipped! The food is so bomb! I ordered the double vegan burger with curly fries and a mango milk shake and everything was delicious! The mango milk shake was super sweet, but I still loved it!
I got the burger with fried zucchini.  I didn't really care for the burger patty but it was good enough.  I loved the zucchini!  I tried my friend's curly fries which were also pretty yummy.
Yuck the burgers taste like Asian food. He makes these homemade and they are not good. They didn't have ketchup when I visited, how odd. The drive thru worker looked like she was on drugs.

Wow! How nostalgic it was to go through a drive through and get the vegan equivalent of junk food I have had when I was a kid. The burgers were so tasty and fresh. I wish I had order a milkshake to see what it tasted like. I'm sure I'll be stopping by soon to try it next time. The prices are also very reasonable for vegan food. The staff were also very friendly. The only drawback to the drive through was that it's not very quick since everything is made fresh which is better than having something sitting for a while. I really enjoyed this place and can't wait to visit again.

The mango shake was delicious  husband ordered a vanilla shake.. he loved it.. we also ordered burgers and fries it was good.. the drive thru lady was nice.. I'll definitely be returning for another mango milkshake LOL..
The burger wasn't the best vegan burger I've ever had, but it was pretty good. It was really close to a In-n- out burger.
I had a double plus chickenless pieces. Very good, and s choco shake. Ill go back when i visit vegas again.

Very poor quality. The cashier barely knew the answers to my questions. I ordered a chicken turmeric salad. They forgot the chicken. When I went back in and asked for it, I saw him reach into a case by the floor and throw a handful of chopped vegan chicken which I discovered was half ice cold when I started eating. I also asked for a side of guacamole when I ordered which they also forgot. I will not go back here.
My wife is the Vegan but i am trying. This place was the BOMB!!! I am sold.... This is my new fast food spot for life!!!

OMG I just want to say I LOVE Vege Way.. My favorite restaurant is Veggie House which is also owned by Chef Kenny who is the owner of Vege Way. Even though I live all the way in Summerlin I make sure I drive to Vege Way to pick up a burger meal with curly fries twice a week. The best here are the burgers and to be quite honest I have not tried anything else other than the cheezburger and curly fries. I LIKE to stick to what I like but I have tried the pop corn chicken and I am not a big fan. It's crispy but a little bland and I am not a big fan of the vegan ranch that comes with it. I have yet to try the other items but I love the veggie burger so much. It tastes so good and I can't emphasize that enough.

I got the Fish tacos. I don't like that there isn't a option to have your fish grilled. I asked the girl and she said everything is prepared and then froze and re heated, "fried" to be exact. The fish looked grey and had a awful taste. The portion size of the fish was hardly any. The tacos were basically filled with extra's. One taco had so much cabbage and Avocado mixture the other taco had none, Literally NONE. I also got a side of sweet potato fries they were cold, and hard. I did order in the drive through so I'm not sure if dining in would have had a different outcome. Disappointed, I was looking forward to a "healthy alternative"
Being Vegan makes this place heaven.   Tad pricey but worth it.  Love the white chocolate peanut butter shake and the Hawaiian Bbq burger.  Epic.

Chef Kenny did a spectacular job with this restaurant and so far everything I've tried did not disappoint. The vanilla milkshake and vegan burger with curly fries is my go-to and is always delicious. I like their flavored dipping sauces too because they are SO tasty. Still have many items to try from Vegeway but with Chef Kenny's track record of delicious food, I know I'm in for a treat! 
As a tip, prices are a little bit more than your average fast food joint. However, when you think about all of the really amazing ingredients that Kenny uses to create these tasty meals, it all boils down to QUALITY OVER QUANTITY! Yes it is still "fast food" but it's got to be better for you than most of the other fast food chains out there. 
Love coming here and hope Kenny opens a location closer to the north side of town soon.

Not a vegan, but I observe when traveling with my vegan brother. We stopped by this place on the way back home to California. I still eat at In-N-Out, so I hope it means something coming from me that this place is a worthy alternative.

I had their version of the Double Double, which tasted pretty close to the real deal. The texture of the patty was different, but not bad. Their special sauce also tasted much like In-N-Out's, but was a little runny. Not a huge deal, just a bit messier when dipping fries. They also have equally great non-In-N-Out food like popcorn chicken, curly fries, and wraps.

Finally, the biggest deal for me as a non-vegan who still eats vegan food from time to time, the price! It costs pretty much the same as the non-vegan food they're emulating, without sacrificing flavor. So if you're generally on the fence about vegan food because of the price, this is the place for you.

I really think this place could take off as THE vegan In-N-Out and hope to see them maybe open up a place in CA!

AMAZING vegan burgers! I was so excited to eat here, and was not disappointed! We got a couple of free burgers for their soft opening; the patty was so tasty and had great texture! I'm glad there's a fast food option for us vegans now ;)

After reading through some of the reviews on here I was excited to try this restaurant. The cashier was extremely helpful. Even when she didn't know the answer to my questions about the ingredients she went out of her way to get the correct answer. Now, to the food...Le sigh...I ordered 2 Soy-free burgers on gluten-free buns, fries and a chocolate shake. Fries were good. Shake was blah. The burgers were flavored well but BURNT. Even the bun was burnt. There were these  long tough pieces of what appeared to be some type of stem throughout the burger. Highly disappointed is what I am. I doubt I will ever return to this restaurant. This was a complete waste of time and money.

Vegan in n out, and the smoothies are better! Awesome that they have a drive thru as well. Prices are awesome too. Im transitioning my Fiance to stop eating meat and he legit cant believe its a vegan burger and not in n nout!

I came here on a Wednesday night with a couple of my friends to check this place out. I was very excited about my first visit since one of my vegan friends has been talking about it for months. 
The menu is pretty small which was expected since there aren't that many options for vegans to begin with. 
I ended up ordering a double burger (2/5) with monster fries (5/5). The price was fair ($11.34 for both items). The fries were absolutely delicious. They have a sauce that's similar to 1000 island dressing that took the cake for this one. The burger was just okay. The bun had no taste to it. 
We also had a side of ranch dressing which was plain and watery.

Went to the VegeWay restaurant and had a very good experience with the food.  it had just opened.  there was a large rush during the lunch time push.  The staff there was working very hard behind the counter to get everything out in time.  There is a really small menu.  They offer a single and double burger.  You get lettuce and tomato.  You have to include your own pickles which are off to the side.  You can get fries and coke to make it a meal.  its approximately ten to 12 bucks per person. There are some other side dish things like fake nuggets.  I have no idea about those things.  They also offer shakes and I didn't have one of those.  Regarding the hamburger, It was one of the better vegan hamburgers I have ever had.  I liked everything about it including the bun.  Each person I was with liked the burger.  We had about (between the four of us) more than 60 years experience combined in eating meat and dairy free.  I don't think it will take me that long to come back.  This is a good place and I will continue to support it.

Pretty tasty! I had the spicy jalapeño burger with curly fries and was not disappointed. I love that there were fresh sliced jalapeños on the burger, I just wish they would disclose exactly what ingredients are in their patties, but I understand they don't want to give away their recipes. Can't wait to come back and try the bahn mi sandwich!
Awesome popcorn chicken and fried squash and their version of the ranch dressing is to die for!

This place has horrible service.  I call in to ask if they have a particular item .  The guy who answered the phone immediately says "I don't even know what you're talking about". I explain it again and he replies "this is the Jones location and it doesn't have anything to do with the other location".  Why is it so hard to just say "No,  we don't serve that item here". Boooooo VegeWay

This was the best veggie burger I've ever had. So yummy! It's clear across town from us but it was worth the drive. We are a family of vegans that actually miss the taste of meat so this real scratched the burger itch. Try it! You won't regret it.

Hell, I'm gonna say it. I was very excited when I first heard that this place was opening since it's right next to my house. I like the concept, but after trying the burger and the tacos. I was extremely disappointed. The food is really trash, the veg. burger is so bad that upon taking the first bite it stuck to the roof of my mouth and I realized that I'm an idiot for getting 2 patties, cause with each subsequent bite i took I had to use the goddamn drink straw andmy tongue to get the sticky soy patty off the roof of my mouth. I only ate half of the $8 burger and threw it out. The fish taco that I got was alright, but nothing mindblowing. There are better fish taco places around the corner and they are way cheaper. 

I'd have given this place at least 2 stars, but the service was abysmal at the drive through. There were 2 girls free with only my car at the drive-thru. They made an eye contact with me 5 times in the 2 minutes I was there, but didn't come to take the order. The lack of service and shitty food make this restaurants one of the rare ones that I give 1 star review to.

Sometimes being vegan is tough when you pass a Mc'D, JBOX all these fast food places where the amazing smell of grease and burgers saturate the air. An right around the corner is this little place where you can satisfy your fast food craving but still remain a vegan. They have several burgers on the menu, shakes, curly fries all in that little fast food setting that you miss oh so much when swearing off meat forever.
This place hits the spot when you want a quick vegi burger with all the trimmings, fries and a shake. The in-n-Out for the Vegans.

Vegeway to me is like in-n-out (but way better because it's vegan) 
I've tried almost everything on the menu and I've loved all of it, it's great

I love this place!!!! I was so excited to learn about a vegan place like this in Vegas. Tried it for the first time today. Everything I got was delicious. Vegan burger, curly fries, popcorn chicken and vanilla shake. I liked the cheese that came on the burger. I will so be back!

Yes it is vegan... So let's get that out of the way....:)

Service was OK... The staff were extremely friendly which would've been a 5 but the speed of the food coming out was a little on the slow side. So yes it is like fast food in the way that your order but the food definitely did not come out fast so minus 1 star. And for the timing as well... My burger came out first and it sat there for a few minutes while everything else on my order was getting fried. Timing was off since everything was hot but my burger was a tad bit cold. :( (3/5)

Ambiance was OK... It was small and the decor changed little from when this was another sandwich shop.... But it was clean just not very welcoming imho... And it was a tad bit cold in there. But the most important thing was that it was clean and that they had a person cleaning and changing out the trash can...4/5

Food was decent. I think veggie house is definitely 5 star... Vege Way not so much. I got their burger and it was decent. But the "meat" was not the best... It was a tad bit on the mushy side but the flavor was very good. Very earthy.... But I wished that they had put more of a sear on it so that it would've had a better texture. (2.5/5)  Curly fries were curly fries (5/5). Fried zucchini was decent. BUT the batter never stuck to the zucchini and it just fell off. It was cool that it was more of a tempura batter then breading but the oil was too cold because it was very very very greasy!!! Flavor was good but it was drenched in oil (2.5/5). The popcorn chicken on the other hand was fantastic! (5/5) perfectly crunchy and not too greasy either. And just like the zucchini this was more a tempura style batter... The texture of the chicken was perfect as was the batter. Very crunchy.  The ranch was also delicious for being vegan. It didn't taste like ranch to me but it had a great flavor. And I enjoyed dipping the popcorn chicken and the fried zucchini in it. (5/5)

Am I vegan...No. was this place as amazing as veggie house on spring mountain ... Sadly no... But was it decent? Yes it was. Will I be back. Most likely. The chicken was good and I really liked the batter. There are also other items on the menu that I would like to try.
They use Diaya cheese which isn't my favorite, but it's a vegan fast food restaurant so Ill be back. I loved the chocolate shake, curly fries, burger is good, and I can't wait to try more food here!

Best Vegan fast food ever! The wrap has a ton of stuff in it. Rice, vegan chicken, cucumbers, some kind of amazing sauce, yum! The vegan popcorn chicken breading is amazing. Look forward to coming back and trying the veggie burger. Hope you open a location in Henderson!

While the angry vegans of the internet are demanding that In N Out create a veggie burger for them, VegeWay is already doing it- the vegan burger here legitimately calls to mind an immediate comparison to the fast food franchise, with fresh veggies, a soft bun, a flavorful patty, special sauce, and fake cheese that miraculously tastes good!

The burger is the star of the menu, available as a single or double AND patties can be purchased to cook up at home- the owner is open about his ingredients and even meatatarians should find the flavors palatable. 

Other menu items are a little less successful- the "beef" bahn mi sandwich didn't do anything for me and was tossed after a couple of bites, and the fish tacos are best described as mediocre.  I've yet to try the popcorn "chicken", because it's always sold out.

Counter service is fairly friendly. They could use a speaker to announce order numbers rather than scream them. Also, there were multiple issues with confusion over the restaurant being closed or open, some customers being turned away, then others being welcomed- it's not a great feeling when it looks like they are picking and choosing who to serve, but it appears to just be confusion.

Awesome!! Wonderful idea!!So excited to find a vegan drive- thru. Great food!! Great Service!! The Cilantro Salad, Burger, Tumeric salad,  Shakes, the fried Zucchini, and all fries were Excellent!!  We even stopped one more time before we left to go home to Cali!! We will be back!!

This place's burgers are fantastic! The fries and other items could use a bit more in the consistent quality department. The service is a bit erratic, and do NOT go to the alternate location (it is under different ownership. 

This is definitely a welcome niche market for those looking to support cruelty free fast food that hits the spot.

Soooo delicious and awesome!! The burger is the best and the popcorn chicken is so yummy! Shakes were okay, my husband loved the chocolate shake but I don't really like shakes so it's probably just me. BUT we loved it SO MUCH that we got dinner, then ordered a SECOND DINNER to GO for later that night haha. It was even amazing cold. I would definitely drive the four hour drive just to get these incredible burgers.

This is my go to spot on this part of town. Amazing. I eat so much when I am here, cheeseburger, curly fries and a shake! they are so light and refreshing because they are dairy free. Must try this place.

Not the best, not the worst. It's a tall order to make a vegan burger, and it's a valiant effort, but Vegeway misses the mark in my opinion. Maybe I'm just a spoiled Californian with easy access to the Amy's brand's flagship restaurant but this place left a lot to be desired.

First of all, the restaurant itself lacks any design identity or personality. It feels very hodgepodge and thrown together. Not a good first impression. 

We ordered the burger meals with curly fries- they were the highlight of the meal, fried to perfection and piping hot. The burger "supports"- bun, sauce, lettuce, onion, tomato were all nice and fresh, loaded on in-n-out style, and the vegan cheeze was also tolerable, but the patty itself was dry, crusty around the edges, and tastes too much like it's central ingredient- cabbage. The proprietor of the business also owns a vegan Chinese restaurant and it seems there's just a bit too much influence from Asian cuisine/flavors to truly call it the "American" style burger it's aiming to be. I love fusion cuisine when it's intentional and both styles of cuisine are complementary but this felt like the Asian essence was competing with the expected burger flavors. 

While they have a few other offerings like popcorn chickin and a fysh sandwich, the menu left a lot to be desired, but it was reasonably priced and service was quick.

The best vegan food ever!!!!
Beyond Burger is their star - has no soy and looks and tastes almost like real burger.

I've eaten here a couple of times, and it is great vegan food for an affordable price. Some vegan restaurants will charge a lot of money for the same thing. I recommend trying your next vegan meal here.

The food is good. And I love that there is a drive-through. However, what kind of place doesn't have high-chairs? or even boosters? Do they hate children? Very disappointed in this. I'll just hold my 1 year old on my lap while we eat ;)

I've heard many wonderful things about Vege-Way and am happy to report that it's all true! Chef Kenny knocked it out of the park with this place. If you are a fan of fast food but want to skip the regret try one of the burgers! The food comes out quickly, it has a "chill" vibe, and everything tastes amazing.

Taste wise--blah.. not so good. Patty Burger tasted too much starch. Needs to work on service and presentation. 

We were not properly greeted. Person took our order didn't appear to want to be there. She is probably an inexperienced cashier. Didn't know how to suggest sales and wasn't friendly. 

Their burgers don't look appetizing at all. See a pic I took when it came out. They literally slapped two buns and some patties and veggie (hardly any) and a ton of melted "cheese" that didn't taste right--we know how vegan cheese should taste like.
I was disappointed with this place, slow service even though I was the only one there. Messed up my order and did not even get it correct :(

Absolutely one of my favorite vegan fast food places, I go quite often because it's delicious! My favorite burger to get is the jalapeño spicy burger with curly fries. Also the strawberry milkshake is the best!!!

So far, I've tried a few things here. The veggie chicken wrap is very good, but I think they over do it on the brown rice.  I think the coleslaw they have here is pretty fresh and had a good crunch to it.  I've ordered the chicken Cajun burger, that one was chewy ant the patty kept sticking to the roof of my mouth.  I'm thinking it's a tapioca based party. The veggie burger however, was pretty good.  Great bite and taste.  I'm not vegetarian or Vegan-but I go here for the flavor of the food and a break from meat.  
The wait of the food is long and that's because it's all made to order.  This doesn't upset me.  The owner/chef Kenny is usually here and is extremely Hospital and accommodating.  I recommend this place even to the meatiest of eaters.

Update 2/23/18
Dear chef Kenny, 
Your worker Athena seemed pretentious and rude today. When asked about nutrition facts about the food, she replied,"I have no idea," then she gave me a box of food without bagging it and just looked at me. I had to ask for a bag and she seemed to be annoyed. I don't even want to come back because of the way she was.  Can you please tell your workers to be more considerate ?

Just had an experience there that was frustrating enough I had to Yelp about it before we even eat the food. We walked in to blaring EDM music with screaming tracks. As in, 1am downtown bar loud and most of the staff were dancing and head banging to it. 

Listen to whatever you want -- I was 18 once too, but it's not the Electric Daisy Carnival, you're at freaking work. Turn it down. 

We were going to eat there, got it to go so we didn't have to listen to that.

Not surprisingly, when I ordered, the cashier couldn't hear that I ordered two double combos. We pay and walk over to the right and realize we didn't get cups. I turn around and politely ask "hey can we grab the cups?"

The next minute was like an SNL skit of what everyone complains about millennials. 

Rather than just say something normal like "oh, I'm sorry, I didn't hear you asked for combos, let me charge for the difference," (aka: what to do when a totally understandable mistake happens...not a big deal) the cashier starts rudely (and totally unnecessarily) arguing with me on whether or not I ordered combos.

Seriously. I'm having this conversation. Well, trying to, I can barely hear over the music.  

Even says "Oh, and like you didn't even tell me what kind of fries you want," like that was his big evidence to make sure I knew I was the one in the wrong. Because, of course, the customer is totally responsible for knowing there are options on that one. 

After a little more equally unnecessary back and forth he finally says "uh I guess I can fix it." Thanks, dude. That should have been Plan A.

I've been there before and had everything been fine, but this experience kinda killed it for me. Definitely a lapse in management to have walked into the restaurant looking and being run like that.

Already a fan of Veg house, now fast becoming fans of Vegeway! Everything on the menu so far is delicious and impressive as always. Still a bit higher prices than the non-veg alternatives, but great atmosphere, enthusiastic, friendly staff and clean, clean tables and facilities.

This is amazing. Talk about Vegetarinism and Vegan Veganism really coming around!!! Love their burgers, curly fries and popcorn chicken. My whole family loves it here including my meat eating boyfriend. My boyfriend is from Dan Diego and is hispanic, he says the fish tacos here are the best he has had in Vegas!

This place is so awesome and convenient! So nice to drive 10-15 min away and get a burger, shake and popcorn chick'n that's all vegan. Finally! I give this place 4/5 stars because they use Daiya cheeze for their burgers. I'm a true fan of Follow Your Heart, which tastes so amazing! Hopefully they switch because the Daiya overpowers the burger. I ordered the burger the following week w/o the cheeze and it was better. 

My two absolute favorites are the strawberry shake (mmm) and the popcorn chick'n (mmm-mmm-mmm!). Come get yours!

P.S. Don't sleep on that Cajun ketchup though. The hit!

Didn't even know a place like this existed until I just happened to drive by.  Went through the drive-thru since no one else was there.  Got a combo plus the fried zucchini.  Took a little longer than expected, but when I received my food it was all very fresh and very hot.

Curly fries were delicious and not greasy at all.  The "burger" was extremely tasty with that hearty, meaty feel.  The "cheese" was melty (which, if you're vegan, you know is very hard to find) and delicious - and saved me from my lactose intolerance.  I also got a side of the fried zucchini which was straight from heaven.  The vegan ranch that came with it was not-so-much: a bit watery, but the flavor itself was decent.

I will definitely come back here. I want to try the vegan milkshakes!

Love that this was literally 15 minutes away from my job at Fashion Show Mall...food was ready after order in 5minutes, was hott and delicious, and worth the investment for food on the go w/my fastpace lifestyle! F'N love this restaurant! An LV staple for sure!

Subjectively speaking that vegan chicken wrap was the most disappointing $8.00 that ever became of my money.

 Objectively speaking though it was the most amazing transaction to have ever happened in human history, Vegeway gave me a pile of mouth turd and I gave them 8 of my precious currency. 

I typically like to go to Vegan places once in a while in a ditch effort to save the animal kingdom one more human life's worth of food in meat (that thought was a lot to chew) ((as was  the vegan chicken wrap))
, and thought "hey who better to ask what to get at a vegan place than the workers" 

For 1: dude was so annoyed I  asked. 
For 2: dude was so annoyed I even existed. 
For 3: dude made me legit sad I even came here
For 4: who tf hire dude???

Honestly, trashiest customer service from any one employee I have ever met. Rest were really nice and pleasant though. (Thats why I gave it 2 stars, go them for having a nicer rest of the staff)

Got my food at which point I gave them another chance. Just like my father's that second chance was for naught. Sucked so much it hurts to even give a writeup. I almost never picked up my phone in an effort to forget this moment of my life ever happened. 

But I really couldnt help feeling guilt for all the lives I could possibly save by writing this up (that parallel convergence with saving animal lives tho), so here I am. Save yourselves, it's too late for me. 
*reaches up towards camera*
*slowly loses grip*
*pan camera away from lifeless body*
*wow im a nerd*
It was good.. but the cheese through me off lol... It was very different from what I have been use to. The only thing I didn't like was.. everything was overly greasy.

Today was my first time visiting this place and I let them know. They went out of their way to make sure it was a really great experience. Super friendly Plus the food was so perfect ! I was the only vegan in the bunch but I wanted to eat some fast food with everyone & by the time I got my food my friends were raving about how good it looked/smelled. I tried vegan Ranch for the first time! It was Amazing & I don't even like regular ranch. So glad I found this place on this trip. It's like a vegan in & out,so if you loved that place as an omnivore then you will love this as a vegan!

Burgers are good but compared to other vegan fast food around the country they are behind! Chicken sandwich was horrible I get better frozen ones from the store! Pretty disappointed! I will only eat here again if they step it up or lower prices! I would say it's like eating vegan McDonalds or Burger King! It's sucks that I have to bash a vegan place but can't lie! People that say this is amazing either haven't eaten anywhere with quality vegan dishes or just transitioned and was eating crappy food before!

Meh. I mostly wanted to try a plant based fast food chain, but it smelled like total fart in here and it was a little depressing. I had the burger and popcorn chicken. The burger was decent but the popcorn chicken smelled like fart. The vanilla shake tasted basically like silk vanilla soymilk blended with ice, not decadent at all. I also had a bite of the hawaiian burger, which was good. I was full from this place for likr 4-5  hours after. it isnt the worst but not the best but worth a try if you are curious about eating vegan/vegetarian fast food in Vegas.

I really really want to give this place a better rating. For what it is, the food is good and definitely works! The milkshakes are awesome!!! I have had a few things over a few visits, burgers (with cheese and not) fish tacos, chicken poppers, fries. My fave are the burger without cheese and zucs! I hear the chicken sandwiches are great but I've never been a chicken fan so I doubt I'd like fake chicken. But man.... the staff leave las so much be desired. I am not looking to be entertained but a smile and some sort of personality would be a plus. No smiles, no emotion, no help when asking a question from cashier. Then in the kitchen was 2-3 employees Staring at a screen watching loud music videos. Just kinda odd....   nothing about my most recent visit was inviting and I kinda wish I didn't leave a tip now.

Probably the worst service on Planet Earth. Rude children working the counters and drive through. Food is okay and worth it as a vegan treat once and awhile, but like I stated previously, the service makes you not want to bother.

I thought this was a solid meal at a fair price.  The burger was very similar to In-N-Out in construction, size, and taste...almost.  The curly fries were good as recommended but not super awesome...in other words not worth a special trip but definitely good.  The cajun sauce was excellent as well.  I will definitely return and bring my Vegan millinials next time they are in town.

One other great thing about this place is they sell their burgers in 6-packs for a super price.  That is great little extra.  Nice idea and nice delivery...stay the course.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon with my daughter. We ordered the single veggie burger with cheese, fried zucchini, and the cilantro chicken salad with the tumeric dressing. We both enjoyed it thorougly ans the food came quick. The service was fast and the cashiers were friendly. 

I am happy to find this alternative place to eat at instead of the other joints. I'll be making my way here alot more frequently. 

We need more places like this in Vegas, everyone needs to come here to support.  :-)

I actually went to the centennial hills location but ur was the best thing of my entire life !!! 100% love the food & staff & fact that everything here is vegan!!! 

truly the bets place I have ever been to, I could go back every single day of my life

the food is decent but not my favorite when it comes to vegan options. The best things at the restaurant are things that can pretty much be found anywhere like the curly fries and the Chocolate shake.
This place is amazing  best vegan burger and beef hogey sandwich. I'm from California and this place is the best. Highley recommend.

Honestly this place is so overpriced to me! I've come here several times and every time I tell myself I'm never going again. The burgers aren't even very tasty and the veggies they put on them don't even seem that fresh. The other week I got a spicy jalapeño burger and the cheese wasn't even melted. It was like a thick slice off a hard block or something. I don't get it. Cheeseburgers should have MELTED cheese on them. 
I do enjoy the Beef Banh Mi sandwich tho and the only other item I liked, they got rid of, Fish Tacos! Boo!
I would rather purchase a two pack of Beyond Beef burgers and a pack of Follow your heart cheese and make a much tastier, less expensive burger at home, with MELTED cheese!

Oh my goodness! Best vegan burger I have ever had! The "meat" was so delicious and had a lot of substance and the cheese they used was so creamy and savory that it pulled the whole burger together! Can't wait to go back and try the popcorn "chicken"!

If you're an experienced vegan who's use to trying all the wonderful options veganism has to offer steer CLEAR of this place! Horrible customer service and probably the worst experience I've ever had since going vegan. Waited almost 20 minutes for fries they left off our order because all the employees were busy with gossip hour. The food was a c- at best. Way over priced, even for vegan food. Sub par vegan food at that. Looks like a lot of people were complaining that they're always out of x,y,z flavor(s) of their shakes which I can attest to because they were out of the strawberry shake. Also, they have a B for a health code rating so there's that. Do yourself a favor and pass on this place. There's way too many other GREAT options in the area.

Also, the wait to get our order was ridiculously long. Nothing fast about this fast-food place. And cashier had a bad attitude. Lastly, it was about 60$ for 3 people.

We were in Vegas for my birthday and had to try this spot! The fact that they had a drive thru was a plus. The food was fresh, although we got there 5 mins until closing, and the lady at the window was nice. Literally tasted like a Big Mac ( from what I can remember). Not the healthiest option at all but who wants to eat healthy on vacation? 4 stars for having to pay extra for the special sauce but will definitely be back.
DIRTY Resturant!  OLD food!  Everyone who ate here got sick under 30 min after eating!

We have tried their jalapeño burger, the Hawaiian burger, double cheeseburger, monster fries, and the best fried zucchini's ever! Price is great! Portions are great! Just wish they were open later at least on weekends. (Pls make this happen!)  hands down the best! Can't wait to try there breakfast and other items in the menu!  my favorite so far is hands down The fried zucchini's and the jalapeño burger!
Had a vegan burger meal and a double vegan burger meal and they were amazing! They only took about 7 minutes to complete the order, the the fries weren't super salty which I loved.

First time eating here. Food was not that great for 24 dollars to feed two people. No justification for value and price. The employees had little to no professionalism. It's a sketch place to eat. I was hoping for a great experience, but I've had better vegan food in a better environment.

I always want to try this place driving by... so today was the day I go the vege way...
1.  vege burger.. not too bad.. decent. cheese is good. can't tell at all.
2 . the zucchini fries- yummy crunchy
3.  cilantro salad- decent
Total = $15 bucks

I'm from California so I have been to many veggie restaurants down there and its soo good. .. so this place is only A-OK. with the quality and price. Selection is minimal.  To go fully the vege way I say no way.

I'll stick with eating meat with my veggies. No carbs.

Feeling for vegan in Vegas ? This is definitely the spot. You won't be disappointed. Had the vegan fish taco and  the double vegan burger with sweet potato fries with a vanilla smoothie, ammmmaaazing.

Great spot of a quick meal. I'm not vegan by any means, but I do my best to cut back on meat. I had the beyond burger and curly fries which were both great. I'll definitely be back to try third other options.

Amazing fast food option for a plant based diet. The drive thru line took a little long, but it was worth the wait! The gentleman helping me at the drive thru window was so friendly and helpful! I'll definitely be back when I'm craving a burger and fries.
Curly Fries and double cheese burger was delicious! Regular fries were ok but curly are wayyyy better !! Oh and there sauce was delicious I put that all over the burger and dipped my fries in

The food is amazing. It's like a vegan in n out but better. Been there multiple times and we always try something new. Everything has been delicious. I definitely recommend this place to vegans and non vegans alike. My non vegan family approved it and they're super picky.

I went to the centennial one. I read a lot of people complained about grease on their fries so they must have changed it because now they are dry haha. They were hot though which was great. The burger was pretty good. Definitely a place to go to get healthy food, not necessarily delicious food aha. Great service though. Friendly staff.

Wow! I am thoroughly impressed. So much so I felt compelled to leave a review which I seldom do. Let me start by saying that I am not a vegetarian, pescatarian, vegan, etc but I would definitely come here again. We had the chicken nuggets, beyond burger, and beef sandwich and all of them were great! Don't knock this place until you try it. The food speaks for itself. The staff is great too.

Amazeballs !!! I have discovered the Vegan In-N-Out... The burger is very good for vegan. Tastes like a regular beef burger. Curly fries were seasoned perfectly & crispy.  And we also had the white chocolate peanut butter milk shake. Delish! Not overly sweet & tasted like a regular milkshake. All in all, great food, great service. My only complaint is I read about vegan cheese & I had asked for no cheese. They mistakenly added the cheese & it's the only thing I do not recommend on the burger. But the owner offered another burger without the cheese (very nice of him) but I wasn't that hungry. I will definitely return again and again. And a second location to open soon (early next year) so I will definitely frequent the new place. Go Vegeway! Loved it!

Veggie House is my go-to vegan restaurant in Las Vegas, so I was ecstatic when I found out Chef Kenny was opening up a plant based drive-thru burger place. A vegan food drive-thru spot? Twenty something years I've been waiting for this moment. I got off work early and knew today was the day. The whole way over I was giddy with anticipation, I couldn't get there fast enough.
       The hardest part of hitting up a new spot is what to order. What if what you order sucks?Do you come back again in hopes the next thing you order won't? So I always get like three things(which is always way to much food) but my feeling is it's worth it to go a little nuts the first go because if all three things suck, chances are, I'm not coming back. I went through the drive thru which could have been a little faster, but it's quality food so it was worth it, and the employees were super friendly.
 My order:
Single Veggie Burger: I really wanted to love this, but I'm not a fan of daiya cheese(the whole boogery/gritty consistency, lack of flavor/pungent tapioca flavor isn't my thing). The patty itself was delicious though, so next time ill opt for it w/o cheese.
Now for the good part...the Vegan Beef Sandwich. This is up there with one of the best sandwiches I have ever consumed. A delicious buttered bun (caramelized just on the edges so the bun still hold the chewiness without overdoing it), amazing veggie Beef, shredded carrot/daikon, jalapeño, Mayo and cilantro. I can't say enough good things about it. For years any time I would get a Vietnamese sandwich I'd order it w/ tofu, but the flavor and texture was never there. The Veggie Beef in this things is incredible. The texture and marinade are spot on. It's like the sandwich I've always dreamed about. My only complaint, next time I need to bring my bottle of hoisin sauce. Soo good on Vietnamese sandwiches.
     Fried zucchini was delicious. Not too greasy and the ranch was good. 
    Vegeway is definitely going to be seeing more of me. Next time I want to try the veggie chicken wrap, milkshakes, tacos, etc,etc, etc. Eventually I'll make it through the whole menu. Thank you Chef Kenny for bringing such delicious food to Las Vegas, and especially one with a drive thru, for those nights when I'm craving that sandwich and don't feel like getting all dolled up.

When this place first opened it was the BEST. The idea of vegan fast food was new and amazing and you could tell the owner really cared about serving tasty vegan food. The burgers were juicy and the fries were crunchy. Now the fries taste like McDonald's fries and the patties are hard like a rock most times. They charge 25 cents for a tiny dipping sauce that they don't even fill to the top (they didn't used to charge) but I guess they've gotten greedy and changed the ingredients to the cheapest possible and absolutely must charge per sauce. What I'm saying is this placed USED to be the shit when the owner didn't care more for profit than quality. You want good vegan food? Go to violettes vegan on Durango and desert inn. Get their tempeh bacon burger and fries or anything else on the menu. if you're new to vegan food or trying to open the mind of a carnivore to a vegan diet.... do NOT GO HERE it will scare you away and I promise not all vegan tastes this shitty. much love.

Always drive past VegeWay on the way to a friend's house so I decided to try it out. VegeWay is a fast food restaurant that serves vegan food aimed towards people that have a particular diet/lifestyle or want to try something new. Its location is small, but does have a drive-through. 

I wanted something light for a snack so I went with their popcorn chicken. For the price I paid I was expecting something a bit bigger. The popcorn chicken did taste like chicken, but I thought there was a bit too much breading.
