The side dressing or sauce that came with the popcorn chicken was definitely not ranch and tasted like it was watered down. 

As of right now I'm not a fan, but may come back to try their burgers and other food.
Great Cilantro salad, it was fresh loaded with flavor. As always the fried zucchini was perfect. I love this place and even more so what it stands for.

God dude I'm so excited about this place. Just had the Hawaiian burger with curly fries and I had to unbutton my pants, I've never been this full. So satisfied, my meal was delicious. I'll be making this a regular lunch stop.

Being a vegan from Orange County I scope out my eating options whenever I travel and make a list.  This place has been on my list through a couple Las Vegas trips but this last one I stopped in not once but twice.   Since transitioning to a vegan diet I have missed having fried zucchini, one of my all time favorites.  Vegeway nailed it! I got an order both times and their ranch is good too.  I had both their popcorn chicken and their orange popcorn chicken.  Both were good however the plain popcorn chicken was better with ketchup.  The burgers were also very delicious.  It's too bad this place wasn't here when my brother lived around the corner.  I will definitely be back!

So Vege-way opened just after I turned full on veganesque.  I'm not hardcore vegan, but it has been neigh unto 2 years I have been meat free.  At that time this place was wicked good.  And, it became my go to "fast food" place to hit when I felt like a burger and not cooking.  So I've eaten Vege-Way no less than 20 times.  Recently, not sure if the recipe changed, but the "burger" is different.   Here's a few more observations over the 20 times I've visited.  First, I pretty much always hit the drive through and my conversations with the person over the speaker system go like this, I kid you not:  hey what can we get for you?  I'll have 2 cheeseburgers 1 order of French fries and 1 order of curly fries. Ok so do you want sauce with your chicken bites and zucchini? Um no. 2 cheeseburgers 1 order of fries and 1 curly fries.  Ok so I have a wrap, a double burger, you want cheese? And 2 fries.  Um no, I want 2 cheeseburgers 1 French fry and 1 curly fry.  Oh sorry do you want cheese?  On my cheeseburgers?  Yes I want cheese on my cheeseburgers, please.  Ok so I have 2 burgers with cheese and 2 fries.  Hmmm no. 2 cheeseburgers and 1 fry and 1 curly fry.  Oh ok got it.  Frustrating to say the least.  Second, when I first started going here the fries were great! And you got a decent portion for the $2.75 they cost. The last 4 times, the fries have been different cuts, different styles and different quantities. I got home and found I only had 20 fries in my order, yes I counted and I didn't eat them on the way home.  Third I've never seen the same person working there, ever.  And the drive through conversation is virtually the same each visit and the quantity and quality is different as well.  Hmmm.  Because of the fry issue I actually stopped ordering fries here and will stop somewhere else for fries which, takes all the air out of the sails of "fast convenient" food, when you have to hit 2 places.  Also makes me have to choose which item I wanna eat cold.  Another gripe, is cost.  Eating out is a luxury, but when you're eating fast food and never leave a place for under $20 for two and have to hit a second place to get sides and have to go through the painful drive through, you gotta ask, how convenient is it and why am I still gong and why am I spending the same for a burger and fries as say a nice sit down place with linen napkins?   Well I do love the place and love the concept even though I have to work to eat here.  


Vege-Way compares itself to In-N-out. By design- In-N-Out  for vegans!  Here's what the difference is and what In-N-Out does right that Vege-Way does not.   In-N-Out limited menu and secret menu. They limit what they produce so it's consistent and good every time, and the secret menu is genius.  Maybe there's a secret Vege-Way menu and why the drive through person never understands what I order.  In-N-Out is fast and convenient locations all over and you don't have to hit a second place unless someone in your crew wants chicken or something. The fries are always the same, always. And they are over flowing from the paper tub and I've never gotten cold ones, not ever in like 20 years of going there.  It is also cheap.  I mean the price has been virtually the same for that 20 years.  For less than $10 you can walk out full.  Vege-Way is no In-N-Out replacement, it is good if not inconsistent, and I love that I can get vegan eats on the go but some of the issues need to be ironed out.

Came here because I was craving something healthy, but there is nothing healthy to be found. Everything is basically fake meat, cheese, bread or deep fried. For a place called VegeWay, there's a serious lack of veggies on the menu. 

Tried the deep fried zucchini, it seemed like the oil they cooked it in was too cold or something. They honestly just tasted like grease soaked, lightly breaded veggies. Ick.
I had to try this, after loving Veggie House. And I was not disappointed! The cheeseburger tastes so satisfyingly meat-like, it almost puts you in shock!

THIS IS MY FAVORITE VEGAN FAST FOOD!!!!!

I have not tried the tacos, pop corn chicken, and chicken wrap. Their milkshakes are to die for! I am loving the holiday flavor shakes they have right now. Their special item, buffalo chicken sandwich was 7 on a scale 10 being the highest. I am obsessed with their burgers and curly fries combo meal. It is $10 rounded up. I have gotten avocado before but it makes the burger messy and hard to eat, too mushy.

This place is great for a quick stop for burgers and fries that are vegan! I especially LOVE their zucchini fries. My only issue, which is small, is the cheese. I'm weird about vegan cheese, but mixed with anything else on the burger is still delicious. I would recommend this place to any vegan or nonvegan too!

The staff is friendly fun and the store is clean. These are just cool points in top of really good food. The curly  fries are better than jack in the box and the regular fries are real potatoes. The cheese is so cheesy...not that daiya crap. My favorite item so far is the ranch dressing, yes the ranch lol It has been way tooo long since I've been able to enjoy that flavor, but vege-way brought it back to my plant based life and I'm so happy they did. This makes me have to try vege house now. Thanks vege family!

Where do I start? I been. Vegan for about a month. I really thought I gave up all delicious food that I once knew to become vegan. One of my close friends told me about this place that had open. I was just able to try it today in oh my god so delicious for vegan fast food. I had a single burger I also had the popcorn chicken fried zucchini curly fries and regular fries LOL. I really wanted to try everything! All satisfied my taste buds. The burger was delicious the cheese on the burger actually was very tasty it tasted pretty close to the in and out burger. Fries were crisp and tender inside. Fried zucchini the tempura they put on it I don't know how they do but it was incredible. Popcorn chicken delicious nice texture and flavor and the sauce was amazing. My friend had a salad it looked incredible I took a picture. I did not taste it so all I know is she said she loved it. If you just became vegan or a long time vegan I would imagine this place satisfies the need for fast food. The only request and I only dream is that they build one in the north part of town so it is closer to me. Thank you Chef Kenny for creating this beautiful establishment!

I am not a vegetarian, but I keep coming back to this Vegan fast food spot. If you didn't tell me that the vegan beef sandwich wasn't meat, I might not notice because it doesn't last very long in front of me. It's sort of reminiscent of a Vietnamese sandwich, and a good one at that. It's got crisp veggies and well seasoned "steak." The vegan burger unfortunately doesn't get the same praise. It tasted and felt slightly overcooked, and overloaded with an excess amount of lettuce. 
Overall, if you are looking to try something new, or just want some vegetarian food without paying too much, it's worth the stop in.

Honestly heartbroken.. this used to be my FAVORITE vegan restaurant, and would come on every single one of my days off, as they are closed before I start work, and are closed again when I get off. 
Anyway, the past four times I've been here, I have been unable to eat the food I got. I'm incredibly allergic to raw tomatoes, and always make sure to ask for them to not put any. They used to be great about this, but with this new wave of hires, they're now putting tomato in every single time, no matter how much I emphasize my allergy. Since these were To go, was not able to catch this before taking it home. Ended up having a severe reaction the first time they put tomato. 
Today we stopped by to grab sandwiches.. my chicken ranch was TINY, with only the patty, some super witty, almost bad lettuce, and the sauce tasted so expired I had to spit it out and could not continue eating. Never experienced this here, but now very hesitant to return, as these past 4 meals have had to go to waste

One of the best vegan places I have been to. The other location is okay. But, this location is the BEST. Everyone that works there is so nice and the food is so good. It's a very welcoming environment. Also, it's very convenient for vegans when they're trying to eat out. I go here very often after work or when I have the munchies! Definitely recommend this place!

You can't even tell it's all veggies! I ordered their zucchini fries and their banh mi. Yummmmy! My husband ordered their cheeseburger and he loved it - said he felt like he was cheating on in and out because it tasted so much like meat! And mind you, he loves burgers! Will be back!

Stopped by on my way out of town yesterday (because what's a road trip without fast food). The cheeseburger was absolutely incredible - the burger, cheese, sauce, and bun were as good as anything I've ever had. I also tried the curly fries, which were perfect. Can't wait to get back to this place although I'm a little concerned I may have a new addiction...
So yummy! I love the shakes and fries!! Vegas is finally getting a few good plant-based restaurants. Try Veggie House too. It's owned by the same people. DELICIOUS Chinese food.

I don't know why there are any bad reviews for this place. I always love the burgers and shakes. Sure it's not the healthiest food but it's a drive through burger joint and that's not it's purpose! Great fast cruelty free food and I have never had any problems with the staff or environment .

I really don't know what to say... As a vegan... The fast food experience is non existent. The fact that chef Kenny brought this concept to life in Vegas alone gets 5 stars... 

The place was busy! We went around 630 P.M. And it made me so happy to see it popping... We ordered two meals... Mine, I did protein style (no bun) no cheese and sauce on the side and the sweet potato fries. My friend ordered the vegan cheese burger, regular fries, and a mango milk shake. The food didn't take to long to come out... We waited maybe ten min total. It wasn't very expensive either... It was around $20.00. 

My food was awesome. The burger was excellent... Grilled perfectly. The Fries were great... Nothing was greasy at all... It was hard to tell this was fast food... And I didn't feel guilty eating it. 

My friend enjoyed his burger. He did not care for the vegan cheese and said next time he would order a double with no cheese. He really liked his fries as well... The mango milk shake was sweeter than he preferred but he said the chocolate and vanilla are his next tries... He was impressed and from a non vegan in and out veteran... That says a lot. I am really excited for the new location that is opening closer to my house! Thank you chef Kenny!!!

I don't know I'm not a vegetarian but I guess it takes a little while to get used to fake vegan cheese. For the price of almost $15 for a burger and a combo definitely not worth it. I could understand if you are vegan and you don't have any options by this place would be a great alternative. But for the rest of us it's just greasy overpriced vegetarian food
Fantastic vegan option, great food and service, and an actual drive-thru that's quick. The double cheeseburger is my go-to; it satisfies like a Five Guys burger minus the greasiness. Love this place.

Today was my first time here and I have to say that the food and service really reminds me of my old fave before going vegan at in-in-out. Burger looked perfect and tasted great too. Fries came out hot and fresh. The drive through attendant answered all of my questions and was super friendly. Thanks for bringing vegan fast food to Vegas! I will be back!

My first visit, I was very pleased.Already a regular and fan of Chef Kenny's  Veggie House, I'm adding this to my faves list! The Vegan beef sandwich or as others call it the Vegan Bahn mi sandwich is the bomb!! I'm not much of a sandwich or burger fan but this sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries and a drive thru? Yassssssss! Love that my fave cilantro salad from the Veggie House is on the menu too. Yum.

My 2nd visit is the reason why I can't give them 5 stars. I ordered the vegan cheeseburger with a side of sweet potato fries of course, and the fried zucchini. The burger was good, but I've honestly had better. I added some hot chipotle sauce to add more flavor. 

I was very disappointed with the fried zucchini. It was greasy and overdone - some of the zucchini were soggy, and the batter just doesn't work. If chef could fix this and get inspired by Farmer Boy's fried zucchini 

I'll definitely be back - but not for the fried zucchini. 

Chef, please bring in your veggie ramen bowls here and my fave salt & pepper Tofu as a side on this menu!

We just had to try chef Kenny's newest creation, a vegan fast food drive-through restaurant. What a great concept! If this was in Los Angeles, it would be a major hit like I'm sure it is in Las Vegas. We tried Burgers, popcorn chicken, zucchini, curly fries, milkshakes, and my only complaint if I had a complaint is that I had to skip the ketchup. High fructose corn syrup.

One of the workers, Marley, was extremely personable, thrilled to have visitors from Los Angeles, thrilled to meet other vegans, and in general, she provided that extra touch that made the experience even more special.

It was my first time trying this place after eyes it for months. I went through the drive thru and order the cheese burger combo. The food was freshly cooked to order and not greasy. I'll be back to visit !

I drove by this place for a while on the way home from work everyday ever since they put up a sign and I've been waiting for it to open and today, I finally got to stop by around noontime and this place was packed! When I placed an order I thought for sure I was gonna have to wait at least 10-15min but, it was ready within couple of minutes and fries were still hot and fresh and the burger was sooo good! I personally like thin patty and it was kinda little crispy too which I also like...I've tried vegan burger made out of black beans and mushrooms before and this burger was 10times better than the one I had before. I'm excited to try different things here next time and their other restaurant in china town also. I'm so glad and happy to see this place busy as a local / vegan. I will be here on weekly basis from now on for sure!

Great food shitty drive threw! Fuck your drive threw
Fuck your drive threw Fuck your drive threw
Tastes good to me. I'm vegetarian and this is the first time I have had vegan cheese. Can't complain. Burger has a lot of flavor. Will be back
I am not impressed. The french fries tastes like dirty oil and the popcorn chicken was inedible. It was gross.

Found this place through a Groupon $14 voucher for the price of $8. I wish this place was closer to my side of town. The space holds a room capacity of 49 max. Pretty slow on a wednesday around 6pm. I enjoyed the Spanish rock punkish music while eating my burger and fries. If youre not a fan of pineapple dont get the Hawaiian burger. The caramelised onions and pineapple together wasn't so sweet but enough juice to really savor this burger. The mango shake was lighter than expected and refreshing. I also enjoyed the sauce that came in the squeeze bottle to go with my curly fries. If you dont have time to sit inside they do have a drive thru which is a plus for a vegan restaurant.

We have been plant based for one year and I'm so surprised that we just found out about this place. We went today and I wanted to order one of everything off the menu but we ended up getting the double cheeseburger and vegan meat sandwich with curly fries and a chocolate milkshake. Oh. My. Goodness. Everything was so delicious. This totally hits the spot when you need fast food in your life! After we left and ran some errands I totally wanted to go back and drive through to get more burgers, fries and a shake. I can't even believe that I can actually say that! So excited for this place. Everything was so good and the wait wasn't long at all. We will definitely be back soon.
Awesome vegan burger. I'll definitely go back

I love this place, it's definitely like an in n out style burger.  Of course it won't taste like what people are used to when eating animal flesh burgers.  But hey, this is junk food for the more conscious humans. 

It's delicious, but still junk food.  

Come here once a month

I think this kind of food is great and many different neighborhoods need and want more of it. However, when I actually ate the burger, the vegan cheese stuck to the roof of my mouth and really affected my experience negatively. I thought that the patty tasted yummy on its own. It was very well seasoned! Overall, I would not crave nor try to come back again unless a vegan or vegetarian friend wanted to try this place again. Service was friendly.

Tried VegeWay for the first time today even though it's right down the street from my house... when it first opened I pulled through the drive through and left because the menu looked cheap and outdated... today we decided to go and try the veggie burgers and curly fries.... the fries were great  I dunno what kind of oil the fry them in tho... the burger was pretty good but I would have liked a multi gain bun... really the only down side and what makes me never wanna go inside again is THE SEWAGE SMELL COMING FROM THE LADIES ROOM.... first thing I smelled when I walked in... it was really gross and I hope they do something about that!!

I got take away tonight and I had ordered the vanilla shake, fries and a sandwich similar to a bahn mi. 

Service was really good, and the food was great. Definitely going to be back!

Decided to give this place a try as a friend had recently changed to a Vegan diet and I had recently stopped eating meat. First impressions when walking in- looks like a old fast food restaurant with old rickety tables, dirty floor.  We were so hungry and were already there so we gave it a try. I had the house made burger with vegan cheese lettuce, tomato and grilled onions and curly fries my friend had the beyond burger along with fries , she also tried the orange chicken. Burger and fries were ok nothing I would come back for. My friend said the orange chicken was ok but needed way more sauce. What was the biggest turn off was that the cashier up front , and the drive thru cashier were handling money making orders  and never once  changed their gloves.  In the areas where the napkins were along with the ketchup you pump yourself the tops of the ketchup was dirty. Eat at your own risk
The most delicious burger I've had since going Vegan. Had the jalapeño awesome. Fries excellent We love your food Kenny.
Amazing Hawaiian burger amazing milkshake. I'm not vegan and I'd go here again over a regular burger joint!

Wonderful food! I especially like the chicken nuggets which are only spicy if you use the provided buffalo sauce. Other highlights were the orange chicken and zucchini tempura. The Hawaiian burger was great but I would rather get the beef sandwich any day. So tasty!

I've been maybe five times and love it. Great veg burgers and fries and the shakes are on point. They always have new interesting things but I love the vegan burger so much I never try anything else. I will some day though.

Good prices. Definitely would go again. Definitely had my fair share of options when I went. Can be described as a vegan in-n-out with the addition of things like popcorn chikn to the menu. Cashier was really rude but I will not let that discount the value of the food.

This is Chef Kenny's fast food endeavor. They offer vegan burgers modeled after In-N-Out. My favorite is the Orange Chicken (ask for extra sauce) and the fries. All-in-all pretty good and totally Vegan. A meat eater would never know the Orange Chicken is Vegan.

Well this was stop #4 on my Vegas Vegan Excursion and all I can say it was definitely worth the trip we made to enjoy a Vegan Burger and Curly Fries. Now alot of people have compared this establishment to IN & OUT Burger and the presentation is indeed very similar. I was a little bit disappointed with the ambiance of the place because it looked like more of a Thai or Asian establishment. Now with that being said I do realize the owner of the location is Asian and in fact there is a sign posted in the establishment advising people to go to "Veggie House" which I assume is owned by the same family. 

I HIGHLY recommend the Double Double Burger.....Curly Fries.....and Drink for just under 10 bucks.....it is the best deal in the establishment in my opinion. We found out they are now serving Buffalo Chicken Sandwiches......Chicken Burgers with Ranch and Fish Sandwiches as well.....all VEGAN of course. My wife upgraded her meal for $2.50 more so she could try the Strawberry Milkshake...... I tried some of hers and it was just "OKAY". Be advised they use SOY and Almond Milk to make their Milkshakes so if you don't drink either of those milks then I wouldn't purchase the shakes.

All in all the service was great.....the food was indeed Delicious and we were literally IN and OUT (get it.....LOL) in about 30 minutes. While not in a very populated area it is still worth the trip to try out these wonderful Burgers and Fries.....Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

Vegeway is a perfect take on vegan fast food. My friend and I ordered the Hawaiian burger, curly fries, popcorn chicken and orange chicken. The popcorn chicken was sooo delicious! It was fresh and crispy and tasted just like chicken; that was probably my favorite thing. The ranch sauce they serve with it is amazing, definitely the best vegan ranch I've had. The Hawaiian burger and curly fries were also delicious. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the orange chicken, I'd go to veggie house for that.

Nothing special in the looks department, it's  just a basic fast food joint.  

But the good is 100% vegan.  And it's all delicious too.  Even grandma thought so, and she's old school meat and potatoes type!

The vegeburgers were good.  The mock chicken wrap was divine, could have fooled almost any staunch carnivore.  Filling too!

The best was the popcorn "chicken".  An absolute dead ringer for the real thing.

Well done, Vegeway!  We'll be back.

Fantastic vegan fast food joint. If you have been to Veggie House (Chef Kenny's other restaurant) than you must try it out too! Me and hubby's first time here after trying out Veggie House 3 times, and we were delightfully surprised on how good the food and service was. 

Environment: Very clean, new place. Not a huge place because you can drive thru and order!

Staff: Extremely friendly girl at the register and the rest was friendly saying goodbye.

Food: Selection isn't huge but you do have a selection of burgers, tacos, vietnamese style sandwich, milkshakes, fried sides (fries, sweet potato fries, popcorn chicken). 

Price: Decent. Burgers are pretty cheap for vegan food. Good deal with the meals (upgrade to a milkshake for $2.50)

1. Double burger: Burger was huge with cheese, 2 patties, onions, tomato and sauce. The patties were moist and flavourful, you can see the plant based ingredients. Wasn't dry and grainy. The only thing I didn't like was the cheese, it stuck to the roof of my mouth in a "fake cheese" feel. Overall the burger was fantastic and flavour was there. 

2. Sweet potato fries: Tasted like any other sweet potato fries. A bit soft but have a crisp.

3. Popcorn chicken: Fried perfectly. No seasoning on it but it comes with a dip and there is ketchup and sirarcha sauce on the side. Soy was moist but a bit stringy. 

4. Mango milkshake: Tasted artificial mango, like a gummy mango candy. I'm not a huge fan of that as a drink but if you like your candy/sweet then the mango is for you!

5. Strawberry milkshake: First sip tasted artificial to me, like syrup but there was strawberry seeds in it. It's not a pink color at all, more white. After a while it's pretty good, and VERY less sweet than the mango. Thick too, just the way I like my milkshakes. 

Overall, great food and price for vegan fast food style. Don't bee too picky, remember this is ALL VEGAN.

Bless whoever opened this place. I have been a pescatarian for nearly 2 months and i've been craving banh mi (vietnamese sandwich). Since i'm unable to eat meat, i haven't been going to my usual spot for banh mi. However, i found this wonderful place! I believe everything at their place is vegan/vegetarian! I got the beef sandwich and i cannot emphasize how tasty it was! It was actually better than a regular natural beef banh mi! All "meat" is soy! It was so good. I cannot wait to come back tomorrow to try their cheeseburger! So if you're new to the "no meat" life and you miss the meaty burgers and sandwiches, go here! It's not expensive, it's not healthy, & it's not meat, but if you want to eat something similar to In n Out or Banh Mi, go here! Plus their vegan sauces were rich in flavor!
Im not a vegan nor choose to be one but Dam that's a good Burger!!! Good Job Vege Way!!!! Highly recommended the double cheese burger. Happy Eating!!!

So delicious that I after eating, I went to the website to verify that it was actually VEGAN and not just vegetarian. I heard about it through a friend and hadn't looked at the website prior to going. 

It truly is a vegan version of In-n-out or Smashburger and I will definitely be a regular here. I hope it becomes so popular that he opens a Henderson location. 

I had the burger & curly fries. My daughter had the popcorn chicken and sweet potato fries. Everything, including the ranch that came with the popcorn chicken, was so yummy. 

Thanks for opening! I wish you great success!

Ordered the burger meal, it was super yummy. I did have one fry that left a mold-ish taste in my mouth.... I don't know what that was....
BUT the burger was super tasty, I'm not even vegan and I loved it! 
The shake was pretty good ( a bit overpriced) 
I will say it was kind of irritating waiting 20+ mins for our shakes.... that sucked. Didn't think it could take that long to make a shake. 
I'll definitely be back though. 
Keep bringing more vegan foods here. I love it

Won't be coming back. Every time I come here my experience worsens. The past two visits the girl at the drive through window provides less than pleasant service, she literally just opens the window and holds the clipboard out not even a "can you please sign?" & your food out with no thank you or sorry for the wait since there seems to always be a long wait. I always order no onions, & the past two visits there's always onions. Why dine at a place where customers aren't valued, ill take my business elsewhere.

The Groupon for this restaurant had been on my phone for weeks when I decided to use it. Went through the drive thru (how convenient) and got the single patty  burger with curly fries, zucchini fries, and strawberry milkshake. My favorite were the curly fries, so good.

I'm not vegan, but I really did enjoy it ! It was really good! I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries and although it was pricey it was really good! I thought I was eating an actual burger! A lot of people come here and I can see why.

My mother & I were driving thru with our dogs, grabbing a bite before we headed for a mini family drive to Seven Magic Mountains. We stopped here to get food to go. Our dogs were barking so hard because they are not well mannered (sorry) & the girl probably couldn't hear a word we were trying to say. She came out to take our order & was so sweet & happy to do it. I was impressed by the customer service for a drive thru order & that is the type of thing that will make me come back. Nice & happy people is whats up!

We ordered a veggie burger with curly fries, a soda, & the popcorn chicken. The veggie burger was really delicious, a nice mixture of sweet & salty. Curly fries tasted like normal curly fries... it's what you expect & yummy. The popcorn chicken was pretty good, not what I expected but I still enjoyed it. I liked the ranch(?) dipping sauce that it came with. 

Overall I see myself coming back to indulge in some vegan junk food. I'm excited to try some of the other stuff on their menu. Out of everything the burger was definitely my favorite so far. :-)
A Vegan fast food restaurant is just what we needed in Vegas and Chef Kenny is just the right genius to do it.  Amazing burgers! Vegeway did not disappoint!
Returned for a fourth time and still cannot tell it is completely vegan. Save a cow and go try one for yourself.

This place is one of my favorites in town. The food does not taste like other vegan's restaurants it actually taste like real meat. The cheese in the cheeseburgers are to die for, so good. The service is always good and the people there are always smiling.
The food is so delicious. I highly recommend this place.
For fast food plant based burgers it was good. I expected a little more, but it was perfectly fine. I would come back again when in Vegas

I really dislike long reviews, but indulge me if you're so inclined. I gave ** as I just don't have it in me to rate it a *. 

*I really LOVE Veggie House and I love Chef Kenny so I am really bummed that I am rating VegeWay as low as I am. I was really expecting a better tasting experience. 

I am huge fan of vegan food and love veggie burgers, so naturally I make them pretty darn amazing. I was super excited to give VegeWay a taste as I do lot of vegan hopping around Vegas and have my regular favorites. 

My experience here, however, was as bland as it can possibly be. For $9+ you will get a small veggie burger of your choice (light or dark patty - some like to call it "chicken" or "beef", which drives me CRAZY that Vegan people would use animal references AT ALL when it comes to foods they eat. It's illogical and ridiculous), a choice of curly or French fries and a small drink. The combo is just way too expensive, considering that making a veggie patty is a lot cheaper than meat, unless you are a shady eatery that buys the cheapest industrially raised meat :(

I could look past the price ($11 with tip), if the sandwich is actually delicious beyond reason, which, sadly, it wasn't what-so-ever. The "chicken"  patty is bland just enough to make you regret the purchase, but not enough to toss it. I finished it and can call this the least memorable food experience I've had recently. Which, again, makes me super sad because everything at the Veggie House is delicious (I was there again this week). 
When I ordered I asked if they have a spicy chicken patty and the cashier said they do and it's a buffalo chicken patty. I thought, GREAT! Love it. But when I bit into it it was just a plain bland patty, topped with the (also) bland Sriracha aioli. When I took the first bite, that aioli.... squirted out of the sandwich all over the tray, my clothes and my phone. I was really expecting a nice piece of (maybe) deep fried "chicken"  with a super zesty, infused crust or a buffalo (red hot) sauce topping, but it was just the stuff they have at the condiment counter. Also, as I kept eating everything was falling out from between the buns. It was a huge mess and I just could not keep it contained. The buns, however, are very good and soft. 

This was not a tasty experience, it was a huge disappointment. I've definitely had way Way WAY better vegan "fast food" in Vegas, where flavor, quality and quantity are major highlights. 

Chef Kenny, please, try better. I'd most definitely recommend spice and herb infusion for the patties. There are a lot of great vegetable powders that can make these patties taste super delicious. Until then, I shall stay a regular at my regular vegan joints. 

Sorry.

This is an awesome place to eat for any Vegan/Vegetarian or even for people who are just looking to cut back on their meat intake & try something new! All of the food tastes GREAT and the customer service is always good. They have a pretty good menu selection, which is nice for Vegans who are used to being limited in what they are able to order when eating out. I highly recommend this restaurant, my fiancé & I eat here at least twice a month and have never had a bad experience!

VegeWay is one of the greatest concepts. Great, greasy, plant based, fast food! My only issue with it is that... it's not fast. 

I have been to VegeWay countless times and I will be back many more. The food is incredible and is great for vegans and omnis alike. The burgers, milkshakes, wraps, and curly fries are all incredible. Definitely give it a try.

I've been here 3 times and I think I am done with this place now. I love that there is a vegan drive tru in town and that's why I am giving this place 3 stars but the food is not great at all. Everything is so greasy and the cheese they use on the burgers tastes super weird. The burger patties need more work, also. Kind of mushy and not great. I've tried the "popcorn chicken" before and it's pretty much just soaked up in oil thick breading with a tiny peace of soy meat inside. I hope they improve in future so we can go again.

My hubs has a weak spot for In-N-Out & this place blew him away!   Vegan Double & Animal fries (aka Monster fries) with milkshakes...YUM!
I have also tried the vegan fish sandwich which was good but I still prefer the cheese burgers ;)
The kids loved it as well

I give them a 3 Star because of the customer service. I've been here a few times and everytime the customer service is not good, the employees sound like they're miserable. The food is really good though. I've tried their burger and fries and the burger is really good! The wait time is long, I spent 5 minutes at the drive thru window waiting to order. And then more time at the window. If their customer service was better, I'd probably come here more often.

I love this place!! A vegan fast food restaurant with a drive through. It's a dream come true! My boyfriend keeps coming back here too and he's not even a vegetarian. The milkshakes are amazing, the burgers are delicious. We need to replace every McDonald's with a Vegeway.
Never dined in but i love this place. The owner even spoke with me and he was very sweet

Simple menu, basic looking fast food but wow the hamburgers were so delicious. Got all the fries (regular, sweet potato & curly), a cheeseburger, chickn ranch burger & a white chocolate pb shake. Chikn ranch burger was good, but the cheeseburger is much better. Milkshake was very rich & tasty! Service was quick & all the people working there were so friendly. Im looking forward to a 2nd location opening!
OH MY GOODNESS! Best vegan burger EVER! I'm so stoked I found this place. I can't describe it you gotta try it yourself.

Grabbed some burger and fries on our way out of town. Satisfied a craving for In and Out. Everybody enjoyed the burger - vegan, vegetarian and carnivore. The curly fries were fantastic! Wish they had one in Phoenix.

Since opening, I came in several times & noticed that their lettuce, onion & tomato didn't seem fresh. I don't eat any kind of meat, poultry, fish or dairy so I always pay close attention to the freshness of the fruits & vegetables on my food. 

The  first time I came in, they ran out of cheese  which is a good thing because they use Daiya cheese which I'm not too fond of because of the sweet aftertaste. The burger is good though despite of their lettuce, tomato & onion not being fresh. The bun reminds me of in & out buns when I use to go there back in my meat eating days.
My sons like the popcorn chicken. I enjoyed the fish taco & strawberry shake. 


The second time, I went to the drive thru. It was an odd process. I waited for a moment & then the speaker told me to wait & then she came on & told me to order at the window. And then...and then...and thennnnnnn.....haha 

Once I ordered, she said to pull around at the side. That was different. I drove around a couple times until I found a parking space. I guess that's the procedure considering how busy it was. It's nice to see a vegan place like this poppin. 

Overall the family was pleased. Grease on grease on grease. Perfect for those kind of days. When the kids want a fast food burger, this is the place. Everything I conjectured it to be. It fulfills it's purpose for a greasy, fast food drive thru joint, vegan style. I love the concept of this establishment. Can't wait to try the other things on the menu.
AMAZING food. I am not a vegan, but this has quickly become one of my favorite spots to eat. The food is good and the people were really nice. Definitely worth a try if you haven't been here.

I went to this place for the first time a few days ago. I ordered the cheeseburger with fries, a strawberry milkshake, and popcorn chicken. The cheeseburger was decent, the milkshake was pretty good, but the popcorn chicken was the best and it comes with a side of ranch. The inside of the restaurant had decent seating and they have an outdoor patio as well. I thought that the customer service could've been a little better as the people were blah. I also wish that their curly fries, or all of the fries in general, were made fresh in house, but I noticed that they weren't as the workers were taking them out of plastic bags. Overall, if I'm ever in the area again and I need some vegan fast food I would definitely consider stopping by.

The best veggie burgers in town. Another great idea from Chef Kenny and his crew.
Everything is super fresh and made pre-order. Everything is VegeWay made so do not expect meat lol.. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Drive tru idea is amazing. Would recommend to all Vegetarian and Non-vegetarian friends.
Love this place! My dad is very picky about food and he also likes it that's saying a lot. Just wish there was one closer to where i live

Let me start by saying that I am impressed by just the fact that I found a vegan fast food restaurant! It's a small building, but easy to find if you're not from the area. They don't have a lot of options on the menu so that was kind of a let down, but I still give props for it being one of the only drive thru vegan restaurants. 

I ordered the cheeseburger and I was feeling extra hungry that day so I also got 2 fish tacos (odd combination I know). The wait in the drive thru was like 10 minutes so that kind of irritated me, it's supposed to be FAST food right?! Finally came to my turn at the window and it took another 5 minutes or so for me to get my food and I was so hungry after a long day, grrr! I finally got to try the food and the burger was very good! The only thing I didn't really like was the sauce in it because it had an odd sweet flavor that didn't go with the burger at all. And for the fish tacos.......I was so disappointed! And I LOVE fish tacos! They tried, but I've had much better vegan fish tacos and again the flavor combinations just weren't there.

Whenever I go back to Vegas I'll definitely try out this place again and get the burger, just without the sauce!

The food here is DE-LICIOUS! The staff is really nice and friendly and I LOVE that they have all sorts of info on why being vegan matters. Our order:

Double burger 
Steak sandwich 
Popcorn chicken 
Monster fries 
Curly fries
Chocolate milkshake 
Strawberry milkshake 

The steak sandwich is so freaking good. The burger was really tasty too but if I had to pick, the steak sandwich wins hands down. 

Both milkshakes were really good but the strawberry one was way more flavorful compared to the chocolate.

The popcorn chicken totally hit the spot. The breading is on the thicker side but doesn't overwhelm the chicken. 

Monster fries were sooooooo good. Definitely not sharing those next time. 

The curly fries were good but needed more seasoning, in my opinion. They were cooked really well though, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

Everything is here is vegan but we still had to ask about cooking methods and they assured us that they do not use any animal products like lard for cooking the food.

It's a good thing I don't live by this place because I would eat there every day!!! Delicious, easy, and decently priced. On this day, I was feeling particularly lazy so I wanted a drive-thru. A rare find for a vegan. I decided to try this place for the first time, it did not disappoint! I had a burger and curly fries and they were yummy. The burger was a little rich, but that's just because I rarely eat anything like this. Good for a once in awhile place!

I really like Chef Kenny's take on vegan fast food. The Vietnamese sandwich was delicious and the burgers were way better than expected. I really enjoyed the variety of fries. I haven't had a shake in 20 years or more and loved that I could indulge. Vanilla, Chocolate or Mango. They were all thick creamy winners. Going to try chicken nuggets one of these times. Making delicious healthy food one order at a time.

We  Veggie House and we're stoked to try Vege Way. We set out with high hopes for this meal, but it face-planted very quickly. While the young lady behind the register was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable it wasn't enough to save this experience.

Atmosphere: Uncomfortable. The 3 employees in the open kitchen were blasting some super explicit music, audible to the entire restaurant. I'm no square but it was SO inappropriate. I shot a side eye and the gent at the line reached up and turned it to something else, but as soon as we sat down he turned it back. 

It's a very small dining area (totally ok with that) but we tried 3 tiny tables and they were all wobbly.  It just wasn't welcoming or comfortable at all.

Food: Pass. The burger patties were mush with an odd unidentifiable flavor. Iced tea was watered down and tasted like it had been brewed a few days before. The fries were good, but nothing we can't get anywhere else. 

We really wanted this to blow our minds and it did, but only because we couldn't believe how bad it was. I'm giving 2  because it's a great idea, just very poorly executed.

It was okay for fast food. I tried the Hawaiian burger with soy free burger popcorn chicken monster fries and curly fries. It kinda reminded me of fat burger. The burgers were sloppy and greasy if you like sloppy and greasy. The best we're the monster fries. The buns were soft I guess we all like our own ways of food. The pop corn chicken was good to for being vegan!

Very best American Burger in town. I got to try their Popcorn Chick'n as well and they were delightful and so filling. The food was made quicker than I expected. (Approx. 5 Min). I walked in and out of there happy as can be.
best vegan burger! simple menu. Can't wait to try the fish tacos

Chef Kenny does it again! I was so excited about the news that this place was opening and I was not disappointed by the food and experience. Walking in I was immediately greeted by the staff behind the counter. I asked the cashier what she would suggest and she told me everyone was getting down on the burgers, sweet potato fries and "milk" shakes. So I went with that and it was all delicious. I inhaled that whole meal with a quickness. I let it digest a little while I kicked back on their free wifi and enjoyed the atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back regularly between my Veggie House visits.
Opened on Durango & Centennial! Yeah!! Love everything on the menu! #crueltyfree #mymealdidntscream

Ehhh, it was OK. Went here with a friend to try it out. It wasn't bad by any means, but just don't know if it was good enough for me to go back. The air conditioning was blasting so made it not too comfortable to sit inside. Food ok, overall experience, blah.

I'm a big fan of the owners vegan Chinese concept "Veggie House," so I've been wanting to give Vegeway a try. I really wanted to like it, but it just fell short on every level. Drove up and the cashier over the intercom was super nice. I began to give my order and she seemed a bit confused and I figured she was training, which made sense, no big deal. A young man took over the order and I stated again that I wanted the single combo with regular fries, a Diet Coke and popcorn chicken. I pulled up to the window and the guy was nice, but he seemed confused as to what I ordered and asked again if I wanted something to drink, I said yes, a Diet Coke. It was a pretty short wait for my food. While waiting I started noticing some of the signage on the window about allergies, hours etc... but everything was posted on printer paper and taped up like something you'd find behind closed doors, not out front where the customers can see it. This is a little thing but it's a sign that the owner/manager doesn't take much pride in how communication is is conveyed to the guests. He handed the bag over and said thanks, I asked "what about my Diet Coke?" He said sorry and gave me my drink. Again, he was super nice but both staff members I spoke to seemed confused and there was only one other car in the drive through. I didn't think much of it and figured this could be just a random circumstance and didn't get bent out of shape over it.

Ok, now the food. The burger was good and I liked the patty, interesting flavor and texture. Bun was good, special sauce was good and fresh lettuce and tomato. Now the fries, they were undercooked and soggy, bummer. The popcorn chicken had zero seasoning in the batter and it tasted like plain tempura batter. The fact that there's no seasoning in the batter and the fries were soggy leaves me to believe that there may be a quality control issue. 

Here's the deal, if you're going to do a vegan version of In n Out Burger, you need to nail every order, every time. That's one reason why In N Out is so successful, great quality control and great food. Again, I really really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't hit the mark. I think a lot of people give it a pass because they are stoked about a vegan fast food place, but it's just not executed as well as it should be. Someone is gonna come along someday and open a concept just like this and do it right.

One last thing. I spent some time reviewing the negative reviews and I didn't see one reply from the management/owners addressing the issues. If you want to improve, you must engage with customers and learn from criticism. It's super important to read bad reviews and address common issues.

We were excited to find a vegan fast food restaurant near our Airbnb. Made our order, we were the only ones in the restaurant. There were 4 workers behind the counter. They some how managed to screw up and gave away our food to the people in their drive thru. 15 minutes after our initial order, we still don't have our food. Again, they said they gave our food away to another drive thru person. This time, the drive thru people actually came in the store and said they got the wrong order. Guess what?? It was our food. Please hire more attentive workers. The store wasn't even busy, SMH. We will not be coming back.

My friend suggested VegeWay so we decided to run out and try it. I am so happy that we did. The food was excellent.  We both had the veggie burger.  She had one with the works and I had one with only lettuce, grilled onions and BBQ sauce.  I have been a vegetarian over 20 years and this was hands down the best veggie burger I have eaten at a restaurant.  The fries were excellent and the service was amazing. We also tried an order of the popcorn chicken. The sauce that came with it was delightful and the popcorn chicken was excellent. I am not crazy about fried food but this snack was good. We called in the order and zipped through the drive thru to pick it up. I will definitely be going back.

Being a vegetarian can suck at times, because there aren't a lot of options out there. I was delighted to find out about this place through a friend of mine, so we decided to have lunch there a week later.

I ordered the double cheeseburger, a side of fried zucchini, and some fries.

Firstly, I wasn't a big fan of the flavor of the burger, but I think that was because I made the mistake of ordering a double, instead of a single; flavor was too overwhelming.

Their fried zucchini and fries were great, though.

Will certainly be back to try another one of their entrees!

Soooooooooo happy I found this place. A vegan fast food place with a drive thru. And it taste like in -and-out , minus the nasty meat. All plant based. The flavor is amazing. And I'm so happy they have a soy free patty. The curly fries are so good too.

Oh yeah. Loved this place, I live on the other side of town and come here. The burgers were so good, really haven't tried anything else apart from the burger because I love it so much. The place could be a little cleaner but I can't complain. Double cheeseburger, sweet potato fries, and a chocolate shake makes my day.

I am impressed.

It's was Soo good.
Everything is delicious.

I'm not a vegetarian and I ordered two more burgers after the first one because it's taste good.

I really recommended go with the jalapeno burger.
My friend is a vegan and when she comes over she loves to order from here. The food is always yummy and very filling, even for meat eaters. Must Try!

Better than anticipated.  I loved the "cheeseburger" and for me the taste was on point.  I however do not eat animal meat and so this burger was the flavor and texture I was looking for.  Also happy to see the serve the Beyond Burger which I also love.  My meat eating friend tried the burger and said it was sweet most likely the non dairy cheese but again the perspective will be different because over time we know as Plant Eaters our taste buds have changed.  I loved it and I will be back!

I'm happy and content. I wasn't sure what to expect as I hadn't read anything about it online. I was a little surprised with the small size of their menu- but no doubt this helps greatly in the speed and quality of their food. I got the popcorn chicken, cheeseburger combo (curly fries and upgraded drink to van milkshake). I was happy with everything that came out of the kitchen. Food was warm fast (even tho they seemed busy inside and had a few cars in drive up) and I thought very well priced compared to other vegan restaurants. 

My main suggestion would be to have a few more sauces readily available (only saw ketchup, jalapeños and what I am assuming was a vegan chipotle aioli which was a little bland for me). 

Looking forward to going back soon - and maybe smuggling a little siracha in with me :)

I am a Vegan and I just had a double burger, fries and a shake at VegeWay in Las Vegas. I feel like I was just at an "in and out" only healthy and vegan.  The food is fresh and delicious.  Their fries are hot and crispy, the succulent double burger is just the right kind of messy and the shakes are sweet and creamy. Its fast food for us vegans!  Finally, i can go to a drive through burger stand like VegeWay and get a bag of burgers to go like everyone else, and not have to compromise my vegan diet.  If you are vegan or not and just want to eat healthy, VegeWay is well worth a visit. Why are you still reading this review? Get there now and get your burger! I am going back soon and so should you!!! Free parking in lot. Double highly recommend.

This is vegan junk food for people who don't care about their health and people who like to sit around.

Because - if you participate in any high energy activities (dancing, martial arts, yoga, meditating) after eating this crap - you will be drained energetically.

Burger patties are WAY INFERIOR to Gardein burger patties found at good quality vegan spots. Obviously those places charge more. BUT even when compared to other 'fast food vegan food', vegeway sucks.

You are literally poisoning your children when you bring them here. If you don't have time to go somewhere else, just fast. Seriously.

I tried the breaded deep fried Orange Chicken and this hit my throat really hard. Total filth.

I like the option to get my burgers wrapped in lettuce, but found the lettuce to be semi-fresh and somewhat stale. Not crisp and fresh.

Food here has the power to make you sick, especially if you have a clean system from eating a clean plant-based diet.

If you want a high quality 'fast food' vegan burger -- go to The Habit! Quality of that burger is much better and the lettuce was fresh and crisp. They also have more choices for fries at The Habit.

My husband and I come here once a week because we honestly miss eating In N Out burgers. While their burgers don't really taste exactly the same, they are insanely good. The ambiance is not my favorite, but then again it's just a fast food joint. You order, eat and then go about your day. I have yet to try the other menu items because I just love the burgers so much I haven't ventured out to anything else. The staff is friendly and there is never a wait to find a seat. You definitely don't have to sit in a long line at the drive thru like you do at In N Out. I highly recommend this place for vegans and meat eaters alike.
Sometimes, a vegan just needs a delicious "milk"shake and some greasy, fattening fast food. And this is just that. It's great for being junk food.

can you say NEW EARTH !? how heavenly is the thought of vegan fast food... where vegans can have a guilty pleasure without feeling guilty at all. its really good and they're always adding more to the menu which makes me want to cry ! I've had the popcorn chicken, the cheese burger, the hot buffalo chicken sandwich, the curly & the regular fries, tried the milkshakes too. ALL bomb dot com with no animals mistreated in the making;) i actually dreamed of eating here last night lol

We never get take-out....ever! However my meat-loving husband wanted to try this place.. my hero 

Pros:
1) Simple menu but a lot of different options 
2) Overall the food was delicious...
     - the burgers had a little smoky taste to them :)
     - the fried zuchini breading wasn't too heavy or greasy...not too much flavor though.
     - curly fries were fantastic!
3) Food was made quickly but not too fast! Everything tasted very fresh. 
4) Price was on point. For 2 burgers, fried zuchini and curly fries it was $17.04. Definitely more than enough food for the two of us. 

Cons:
1) An ingrediant list for their patties would be nice...just to know they arent completely processed.

Vegan fast food.  I give this 3 stars because the drive through service is pretty slow and the food is a little to greasy for me.  The staff is always nice but the wait is pretty long.  It would be nice if they added things to the menu.  I have been here 4 times and each time it has been less and less appetizing.  Vegan food doesn't have to be basic it can be better and continue to be better and that's my only grip with this restaurant is that it needs to update its menu to keep my coming back.

I will NEVER eat here again. I have given numerous chances to Vegway. When someone orders food deliver what they ordered this is the 4th time I have ordered food and not rec'd what I ordered. And your fries are soggy and gross. Thanks for taking away a vegan restaurant that i loved and what's sad is that I love the chef and veggie house that he owns,  this restaurant is wrecking your name and you need to get it together.

I have had my share of vegan burgers, and Vege-Way's are top-notch. The patty itself was not stiff and did not fall apart like so many others I've had. The vegetables were crisp and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place to any vegetarian/vegan looking for comfort food.

I got the vegan burger/burger only and it was literally the most melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful sandwich I've ever tasted. Definitely will be coming back here regularly and bringing friends. Food was fast (drive-thru), service was friendly and good prices. Good job VegeWay! Absolutely delicious.
Love the soy free vegan burgers, reminds me of an In N Out burger, thanks chef Kenny!!

Disappointed. First off it's SO COLD inside. Hard to enjoy your food when trying to keep warm.  Their options are greet, zucchini fries, orange chin-n, hawaiian burger.. But the shake was so gross!  It tasted like finely crushed ice and almond milk, not thick like other vegan shakes I've been had at fast food places.  The burger was okay, the fries okay.  The bathroom smelled like rotting fish or sewer.  Sooo gross.  I'm thankful we have a fast food Vegan option but they need to step it up in my opinion. Just because they're the only ones doesn't mean it's ok to slack.

This place is amazing!

It's hard to find vegan options in vegas let alone a place that's entirely vegan! 



DO NOT pass up any of their vegan milk shakes!! They are all amazingly clean and crispy and super refreshing and it doesn't make you feel like shit like a normal milkshake that comes along with a stomach ache!!


If you are going to get their burgers make sure you order ur with out their vegan cheese because they do use Daiya which isn't the best vegan cheese option! I cAn put up with it but most people can't! I wish they would switch to something from field roast  their vegan cheese is way way better!

Their Curley fries and sweet potato fries are off the hook! Bomb and they def use clean oil because you can taste and smell the fries when they come out!! 


Customer service is pretty average for a fast food  joint! But to say the least awesome quick stop for the vegas vegan!!!

Shout out to the owner for opening up this place it's  awesome wish there was one on the north die by Durango and the 95

Very clean, friendly, and fast. I enjoyed the faux fish tacos. Delicious.  I wish I had more room to try the other dishes.  I'll have to return to try the tasty looking burgers.  So happy to have found this place.

Their "fish" tacos are ahhhmazing! Love their greek cilantro salad also. Try their "chicken" wrap with chipotle sauce, its heavenly! Staff is super friendly, which is ++ for me. The only thing that i didnt like was the peppermint shake, i wasnt expecting it to have a bubblegum taste lol
I just ate two vege burgers from there. The best  I ate after long time.. Everything was perfect. And its next to my house. I hope they get lots of more business..as they are new opened

You know, last visit I had here was OK. Long wait time. This time no wait, but the girl serving me was so rude because I questioned the total of my order. I got a veggie burger combo and it was $10.54. No problem paying it, but it seemed a little much. They were also out of everything I originally wanted which really ticked me off especially because my fries were soggy and had zero flavor to them and were cold. But for the most part, the girl having an attitude with me put me over. Didn't say thank you, nothing. Get a personality.

I went there and ordered a Fish taco, zucchini my favorite and popcorn chicken. The fish taco was very good. The popcorn chicken was dry and the tempura on the chicken was hard and   Over cooked. The zucchini, my favorite was tossed In tempura and it wasn't covered all over, some pieces had no tempura at all. The wait was very long. Like a 20 plus min wait in Togo window. 
The ranch was so-so. watered down and there was barely any sauce for the portion. 
I really enjoy the Veggie House so I wish they would have brought some of those elements to this location.  My total for the three items was $13 and change. Not affordable when I only really ate the taco. Still hungry rummaging thru my fridge. I heard the burgers were winners so we will see. I haven't had a shake yet, I will probably give it a second chance, and try something different but these items are out.

Soooooo good! Was so excited to have a vegan fast food place in town! I've been three times and am in love with the burger! It's absolutely delicious and savory. I also really enjoyed the chocolate shake (the mango is okay) and the curly fries. Can't wait to try everything! I would love to see a grilled cheese on the menu for kids.

Since I gave up red meat, I've been searching for the best veggie burger. This is far from it. But I still love it. 
Now, this is in no way a gourmet burger- it's a quick and dirty fast food burger. In vegan form. And it's pretty glorious. I think even a meat eater could appreciate it. The look of the double vegan burger reminded me of an in-n-out burger. The patties are more on the mushier side, and I know many people who prefer a firmer patty. Vegan cheese is well melted and makes the burger gooey/sticky, which I kinda really enjoy. I did have to finish it with a fork... It's the closest thing I've found yet to a fast food burger, so I'm happy with it. I haven't had the chance to try other menu items besides the fish tacos, which are refreshing with their mango salsa. Way to go chef Kenny!
Will have to try the popcorn "chicken" on my next visit :-)

COOOOOL. Plant-based fast food! WE'RE TOTES IN THE FUTURE YAWL

Ordered the bahn mi (beef sandwich) and sweet potato fries. So happy to finally have bahn mi!! Since I gave up eating meat nearly 3 yrs ago, I've been opting for veggie bahn mi. This beef-like substitute is a blessing to my life.

Bahn mi: served in a hotdog-like white bun that broke apart as I picked it up. Wish they served authentic Vietnamese style like a baguette (PUH-LEEEEASE with a cherry on top honor this suggestion). Other than that, taste mirrored that of an actual bahn mi. Almost creepy and too-good-to-be true.

Sweet potato fries: clean!!! What I mean by this is NOT oily and NOT salty. Seriously, my fingers were spotless after eating them.

I can see myself becoming a regular here as I love veggie restaurants and eating clean. If you are someone who is accustomed to a lot of sodium and oil to flavor your food, you will not enjoy this restaurant. Anyone looking for a cheat meal with cheap prices and whole, nourishing ingredients will love VegeWay.

Wow chef Kenny! I have been trying to get my husband to come here for weeks but being that it's a vegan restaurant he wouldn't go. I found a groupon and figured this is my only way I'll get him to try it. He LOVED it! I was shocked at how fast he finished the burger and monster fries. He was shocked as well. The monster fries are so good comparable to animal fries at in n out. I had the cheeseburger which was delicious! I really liked how it was crispy on the outside. Chocolate shake was good too. Hubby had the Hawaiian burger and he said you would never know that it's not a real burger. Our new favorite fast food place!

it was very disturbing to pull into the parking lot, seeing 4 WORKERS wearing their VegeWay tee shirts, SMOKING cigarettes, at the back wall near the drive thru window. hugh mistake coming here. ONE BY ONE THE SMOKERS, made their way inside to help with food preparation and customer service. Mostly all the food on the menue was fast fried food, all cooked in greasy oil, all fried, all unhealthy fried food, being COOKED by UNHEALTHY SMOKERS ! Hugh TURNOFF !  It's a glorifed fast food place, NOTHING HEALTHY, it's a SHAM ! THEY don't even care to hide their WORKERS SMOKING, from the customers. SMOKERS are preparing and handling your food, at a place that claims to serve up healthy food ! What a farce and mockery on the healthy food establishments . This is a fast food garbage place, with a convenience of a drive thru window, with the WORKERS SMOKING for ALL to see, out front !  it's a dive and a lie ! TRUTH is, its junk food, poor food quality !  glorified fast food crap !!  mostly fried greasy garbage ! its all cooked in grease. by smokers !  unhealthy period !! poor food quality prepared by "smokers"!! How awful !!!  they try to decieve you, by using a vegan name !  its a sham!  it"s unhealthy !! they dont even care that you can watch the "smokers", SMOKE, while you eat inside !  terrible to witness ! horrible food ! never again ! bad experience ! Food is awful, very greasy !!! UNHEALTHY PLACE !!  A complete sham !! Workers where All Nice, Unfortunately didn't know squat about "Vegan Food", The Nice "Smoking Workers", All Clueless, On Vegan Food ! All Young Naive food handlers.

This is the closest (to original) vegan version of fast food I have ever tried. While 'Leaving Las Vegas' (like the infamous movie), we decided to stop by. 

Of course, the cheese burger and popcorn chikc'n are a must!! Paired with fries and milkshake, makes the experience whole.

Although these are not in the healthy side of the spectrum, my palate and bud sensors transported me back in time when junk food used to make me happy. This time, was no different. I used to have this type of combo, after a night of partying... 

Yes, bye Vegas!!! I'll miss you much!

Burger and fries were really good! Popcorn chicken was very tasty but could use a little seasoning. The star was the fish tacos, they were delish! Mango shake didn't really care for but I won't give up and I'll try the chocolate shake next time. Overall food was hot, fresh and tasted good. Service was good but the place itself needed a little tlc in the way of cleaning and just decor. Will be back though for the chicken wrap and sweet potato fries next time!!

Vege Way is the bomb! It's the vegan In-N-Out. Amazing burgers - you won't believe they're vegan! 

Check out Chef Kenny's other restaurant too... Veggie House on Spring Mtn Blvd!
I love that VegeWay has catered to their customers, offering soy and gluten free options.  Their burgers are super affordable, delicious, and there's a drive-thru!

So I guess I will write my review while I wait in the drive thru... I've been waiting in the drive thru for 15 minutes and still haven't gotten my food. What's the point of even having a drive thru if you cannot provide quick service? It might have been better to just park my car and wait inside instead... Other times I've gone through the drive thru, it wasn't as bad.

But besides the horrendous 18 minute wait with no apology, the food really is good and it makes me keep coming back for more! I love their vegan burgers (without cheese - vegan cheese is weird to me) and popcorn chicken. They have so many other options that I want, I mean need, to try! 

I deducted one star for the terrible service in the drive thru, but the yummy vegan junk food makes me a regular at this place!

This place was really good. I ordered the Hawaiian burger with curly fries and a chocolate milkshake. My bf who isn't vegan really liked the double cheese burger. I'm not a big fan of strawberry milkshakes but it was really good!  I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Vegas again.
Enjoyed the burger very much. Chicken nuggets were GREASY and their drive thru was frustrating. Bad intercom. A little overpriced, but convenient for the meatless hunger. I'll give 'em another try.

Great concept - love that there's a fast food plant based restaurant in town. Would be great if there were more items identified as non gmo and organic on the menu. Also, not a fan of the daiya cheese that they use on the burgers. Would love to see an in house option or another brand. Not a strong choice to use in the plant based community as it's one of the least favorite options out there. Keep up the good work and thank you for now 2 yummy restaurants in the Vegas community.

I hate to give this place such few stars but this experience left me confused and disappointed. 

For starters I went to the drive through, with one car ordering ahead of me and another waiting at the window for their order.

I ordered the burger meal with curly fries and a vanilla milkshake and the total was $12.88.

It took 6 minutes from the time I drove up to the window to place the order over the speaker. 

The girl in the car behind me got out and asked me if this was normal waiting time for this restaurant, I'd never been here before and drove a long way to try it out based on reviews. 

She then went to the car in front of me which was at the window and asked the same, only to calculate the first car had been waiting 20 minutes from the time of their order. The people at the window were acting as if it wasn't a long wait or that there was a problem. By the time I got my order in hand, it was a total of 22 minutes, if you include my wait time to order, 28, so that's not fast food drive through. There were plenty of people working inside.

The girl who took my money took 3 minutes to count out my change . The whole thing was frustrating. 

As for the food, the burger was not hot, the cheese needs to be revisited, I like vegan food, this just didn't work well, it was a dry burger. The curly fries were semi warm and tasted fishy. The milkshake was great.

Chalking it up to a bad day, but customer service was substandard and the food wasn't up to par. Also the building looked dark and uninviting.

Hoping this helps the business

I love Vege-Way in North Centennial. On Jones...no so much. They lack variety and food supply. They were out of The Beyond Burger before 12pm. 

I chose the Spicy Chicken sandwich, curly fries and Strawberry Shake. The "chicken" tasted more like a mushy veggie patty. The spicy sauce was lack luster beyond belief, too many thick onions and tomatoes that made the bun wet!!! Not to mention, the paper that the bun is wrapped in was drenched with sauce on the bottom and wet before I even got a chance to eat it. 

I would recommend the other location. 


P.S.  they close the shake machine hella early...like McDonald's lol (I don't eat there but when I did).

Woohoo! A vegan drive thru in Vegas! VegeWay is now on my to-do list every time I visit Vegas. So far I've only tried the burgers and curly fries and love them! Definitely tastes like eating a plant based In-N-Out burger. Highly recommend and looking forward to my next visit.

i wish their menu was more inept, but even with as simple as it is it's so good. with it being made by the same dude as Veggie House - i wouldn't expect any less! try their buffalo chicken sammich :) so yum

Awesome food. Got the double burger with jalapeños and an order of monster fries. Sauces were excellent. Shared some with a few coworkers who are not vegans and they asked me to bring a burger for them next time I go. Best place in town to take care of your fast food cravings. Going back this weekend.

I finally got to check this place out while I was running in errand near by. It's adorable little spot with not much else around it. Everything on their menu is vegetarian friendly and they have a handful of options like burgers, fries or a banh mi sandwich. Think of it almost like McDonald's but without the meat.

This most recent visit I had the cheeseburger with curly fries. I really enjoyed the burger after adding a bit of ketchup and must say it's the closest thing I've had to that real burger taste since going pescatarian. I really enjoyed the curly fries too, they tasted just like Arby's. It is definitely greasy food though so don't think of it as being healthy by any means. 

Overall I'd come back again if I was ever in the area. A+ for being vegetarian friendly and having a drive thru. I only wish there was a location closer to my side of town.

Although I am not vegan, it is nice to see more vegan restaurants sprouting in the Las Vegas area. The concept is good, and there are not a lot of choices, but it I just thought the preparation of the food could have been better. The cheese is absolutely disgusting, but the veggie patty itself, is not bad. I may have try the other stuff on the menu, but the first time trying it with the vegan burger, was not the best experience.

Vegeway is perfect. It's perfect in the same way I used to think Wendy's or McDonald's was perfect - salty, savory, fast, convenient. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy, but it's perfect. 

I came by here after hiking at Red Rock Canyon with my dog. It's hard enough finding dog-friendly restaurants, let alone vegan dog-friendly restaurants, and I was so hungry. To have a drive-thru option at a vegan fast food restaurant was all I could dream of and more!

I opted for the burger meal, with curly fries and a chocolate shake. The fries were some of the best I've ever had. The burger patty seemed to be made out of beans and rice, but it was still toothsome and meaty. With all of the accoutrements, it was a damn fine burger. The chocolate shake was a little icy, but still perfectly reminiscent of the fast food shakes I had growing up. Not fancy, not high quality, but still just what you want. I actually appreciated that it wasn't too rich, so I could fully enjoy my feast. 

I want so badly for Veggie Grill to open up some drive-thru locations in LA, I think it'd be a game changer. Vegeway is proof that it can work and it can be awesome.

Some of these reviewers are so full of themselves, it makes me laugh!!  If your idea of a yelp review is trying to emulate New Yorker, believe their every word.  If, however, you want a vegan example of an InandOut Burger, go to Vegeway.  The pickles are on the condiment counter (duh, to the reviewer who missed them).  We got the double burger, a regular burger, and the sweet potato fries.  Everything was excellent.  There, a non-clever review that actually tells the truth.  Both of us ate for $16.  We enjoyed it.

We first got to try VegeWay during the soft opening, and we knew we would be returning again after the first bite.

Here are the reasons why VegeWay is dangerous: (1.) I am a mere 2 minutes from this plant-based fast food joint (2.) the burger itself has several different textures which gives it a good mouth feel (3.) POPCORN CHICKEN AND MILKSHAKES (4.) three different types of fries and I honestly enjoy them all

Keep in mind that vegan fast food is not meant to be healthy, it is still fast food. But it would definitely be a healthier option in comparison to regular fast food. VegeWay allows anyone to have the fast food experience (greasy, fatty, salty, sweet, and you drive right through) without compromising plant based choices. 

It's only been a few months and they will already be opening a second location which just goes to show that there's a market for vegan fast food. Thumbs up to Chef Kenny for making it happen right here in Vegas!
Good "burger" and fries.  Fast service. Got to talk to The owner. Great guy. More locations coming!

I have come here twice since opening and I loved it both times. The food is hot when served, the staff is friendly and quick, and the burgers , wraps, and fries are DELISH. The milkshakes are delicious and creamy, I love the strawberry and chocolate. Please come here and eat !!! The only thing I wish is that they would use Chao cheese instead of daiya ! None the less TIS TASTY!

First time here and wow I am impressed!! We ordered the double veggie burger, french fries and fish tacos, and everything was delicious!! Can't wait to come back soon!! I am really happy to have found this fast food vegan place!!

Finally! Let's all admit it after spending a weekend in Vegas binge drinking sometimes all you need is a fast-food style burger and fries (greasy and not particularly healthy HAHA). And being vegan and trying to find this is close to impossible.... until I was brought to VegeWay! 

My girlfriend had told me about this spot multiple times but we hadn't been to Vegas so when we finally got the chance to come out here you already know VegeWay was on our to-do list! I will start off by saying if you're looking for the normal healthy, low caloric, etc style of meal turn around lol this is the closest to a Big Mac/In-N-Out style of burger that you can get being vegan and I personally LOVED IT! Now I wouldn't eat here everyday but stopping by on our way out from Vegas is just perfect! 

When we arrived the first thing that caught my eye was that they have a wide selection of food. Ranging from burgers, "chicken" sandwiches, fries, popcorn chicken, zucchini fries, Bahn Mi, fish tacos, shakes, and salads. When we came we got two burgers, regular fries, curly fries, zucchini fries, popcorn chicken, and a bahn mi for the road (yes we like to try everything!). Here is what the consensus is: 

Burgers - 10/10 I'd definitely recommend getting the burgers here. They allow you to get a single patty or even a double. They also have a new burger with guacamole which we didn't do but based off how the burger alone tasted I'm sure guacamole wouldn't be a bad adder. The meat had a really good flavor and the sauce they add is the closest you can get to tasting like you're eating a Big Mac. 

Popcorn chicken - 10/10 I would say these are a solid choice to get. The pieces are pretty thick with a nice layer of breading and deep fried to perfection. The sauce that comes with the chicken is really good too (it was this Cajun sauce). 

Bahn Mi - 9/10 this had a lot of potential to be great but I think it was a bit dry in my opinion. They do put a sauce on it that tastes really good just not enough. 

Lastly of course the fries are good (like all fries are) and the zucchini fries were decent. I would just recommend getting fries unless you're in the mood for zucchini. 

So overall I would recommend anyone looking for a nice cheat meal to come here. Again don't come here looking for anything healthy lol and just a word of caution be ready to fork out a decent amount of cash as the prices are a little steep considering it's fast food.

I'm new to the no meat and dairy lifestyle. VegeWay is definitely a must! First trip I ordered the vegan beef sandwich which is like a bahn-mi sandwich. So good!! Next trip I had the Hamburger with grilled onions. Burger was delicious! (They both taste  better than the bad stuff) I love their ranch for my fries and thousand island sauce for my burgers. My meat loving Husband even said it was good! Close to home too, lucky me!

Really good Hawaiian burgers. The popcorn chicken is so-so. Good priced items. I'm not a vegetarian, but went with a friend who is one and I thought it was just as good as meat, but it's not :) Recommend this place.

SOOOOO GOOD. I'm not even a vegetarian, but trying to eat less red meat. Honestly didn't even miss the meat. Sweet potato fries and strawberry shake also very tasty. 

My only complaint is that this place doesn't have a nutrition facts list for their items. (Is that even legal?) I over ordered so that I could try their food but I bet it's high in calories, so I didn't feel like I should finish it all. Hard to have any kind of idea how many calories or fats are in the food. Nevertheless, a good cheat meal if you're craving fast food.
