Best vegan fast food I've ever had. The staff is always friendly and they always have good music playing. The portions are good sizes and very filling. I recommend the white chocolate peanut butter shake it's so good.

yummyyyy so good! i'm so glad there is a fast food for vegans :) burgers are good, but the popcorn chicken and the strawberry milkshakes holy crap they are SO YUMMY!!! love this place, i hope they open up more all over!

I had a hankering for a healthier/meatless day so I hopped on yelp and found this gem. I kinda knew what to expect from the high reviews and photos. I ordered the double vegan burger and opted for fried zucchini and a water instead of their regular combo. The sandwich was delicious! The patties were a little softer than other vegan burgers I've had but super tasty. The fried zucchini had a light tempura batter and were just as good. They came with a dill creamy sauce that reminded me of tzatziki or maybe it was actually called that. They also had their version of Big Mac sauce. Man those sauces just threw my meal over the top. Prices were good and I couldn't even finish. I was so stuffed that I took leftovers to work and finished them a little later cuz I couldn't stay away. Highly recommend and will be back.

Ehhh, I am not feeling it. I was pretty excited to try this place because of so many raving reviews I've been seeing on social media, but what a letdown. First of all, I enjoy Vegan eats and the lack of meat is not what's missing here. There was just nothing spectacular or even remotely special about this place or its food.

I selected the Double V Burger Meal with Curly Fries and a Drink ($9.89). Certainly not a cheap meal. The burger was ugly and a far cry from their photos (I thought this only happened at major fast food brands?). Their patties are misrepresented as the real product is extremely thin, plus, the fresh vegetables were almost non-existent (there was seriously a leaf of lettuce that didn't even over the size of the bun and these buns are not big). The bottom line, it didn't taste great. It wasn't bad, but I'm certain that it has nearly the same amount of calories/sodium as its non-Vegan counterpart and totally not worth it. To add to the already insulting meal, the side of fries was dismal and probably the same ones you find in the grocery store's freezer section. 

If you're looking for a Vegan place based solely on the fact that you do not consume animal products, then, it's here (though there are so many better Vegan restaurants in town). However, if you're looking to eat healthier, this is NOT the place for you. Vegan does not equal healthy!

Only was able to try the pop-corn chicken today but it was SUPER good! They should serve with bbq or Frank's for dipping sauce tho. 
I was surprisingly impressed with the ranch & I'm actually very picky when it comes to ranch dressing..
I can't wait to go back. 
Wish these kinds of places were all over.

Ummm. Love veggie house, but this place was greasy. I suppose that's the point? The food was falling apart as we ate it. I wouldn't make a the trek again. Might give it a second try, but wasn't super impressed with the first. Perhaps my expectations were too high.

I ordered a double vegan burger over the weekend, and I'm not sure what was so different this time over the other few times I've ordered the same thing... but the burger was not good. It was extremely chewy, the tomato was really slimy and it ruined the entire burger for me. I ended up just finishing the fries and throwing the burger away in disappointment.
Probably won't be going back here anytime soon. The soggy tomato was enough to ruin everything here.

It's pretty awesome. Like In & Out for vegans. I couldn't imagine going to Vegas and not stopping by there at this point. You can Ben get cheese fries. 

Stick to the cheeseburger and fries though. One time I ordered the Bahn Mi sandwich and it was zero fun.
Also, even though it's "fast food" it takes about 20 min to get your order, so be ready for that too.

I wish I could give 5 stars because the food was great. The service, however, was not. I ordered 2 meals and a side of popcorn chicken. I waited 20 minutes for my food, and after seeing people who ordered after me receive their food first, I went up to the counter to ask. There were no cars in the drive thru and no other customers and the employees were just standing around talking. When I asked the reply that I got was an "oh, sorry". No further apologies or anything, which was pretty disappointing.

I was excited to try some new vegan food, but left very disappointed. 

The place was super dirty - no one had cleaned the tables or the floor in quite some time. I hate it when eating means I need a tray and to avoid touching the table at all costs. 

Almost everything was fried and the menu was very small. I guess that makes it easy to make a choice except that the menu is so small that you feel limited to the best of bad choices. Super unhealthy - I guess here the term vegan only means no animal products but not healthy. 

I personally won't be back, but it was obvious that this place has its following. So if you really want a simple vegan McDonald's, have at it. There were plenty of customers, so they must be reaching their own niche which is fine.
The best. So awesome. Vegan. Fast food. Drive thru. Vegan milkshakes. It's like an in'n'out just without the murder aspect. I only wish it was open later.

I love that I can get a cruelty free vegan in and out burger and their vegan popcorn chicken in fabulous! My favorite thing about vegeway is that they have a vegan drive thru so you can get your burger fix without having to get out of your car. One thing to be mindful of if you have a nut allergy: all of their milkshakes use almond milk. You should definitely make this must visit vegan stop on your next trip to Vegas.

I tried VegeWay for the first time yesterday. I ordered a Vanilla shake, fries and a chicken wrap. It was delicious. I was actually impressed with their food. I love that is vegan and super healthy. I didn't feel full or overstuffed. The drive thru service was friendly. I would come here again. A+

My husband literally found this place today and we just HAD to try it out, especially after reading all the positive reviews. So the whole family headed over to try it out and we were all extremely satisfied. We ordered a single burger meal, double burger meal, popcorn chicken, fried zucchini, and a chocolate milkshake. As someone who isn't a vegetarian but has been trying to make healthier choices like cutting out meat from my diet this place made me want to go full on vegan if I could have this everyday. The burger as many others said in their review was the veggie version of In-N-Out and not lacking on taste. The cheese as a few have said left a sweet after taste that I didn't like but my husband who likes sweet stuff didn't mind at all, at the end it depends on your taste, maybe have different vegan cheese options? I could sit here and rave forever about the food but why do that when you could just go and try it out for yourself? That's right, hurry and go try it out now! Last but not least the place was very clean as well as the bathrooms. You will also see chef Kenny the owner in his white chef's coat walking around greeting people and cleaning off tables after customers leave. Also it's a small dining area so when it's busy it can be hard to find a spot to sit and eat, not to mention if you have a little one like myself there are no highchairs, so be prepared to hold them on your lap as you eat. Other than that excellent place!

Woo! Another vegan/vegetarian place that I really enjoy!  The first time I had this my coworker got it delivered & she ordered a "cheeseburger".  It exceeded my expectations of a vegan burger by so much!  So when she ordered again I decided to get the vegan beef sandwich, which is supposed to be similar to a banh mi.  When I took a bite I could not believe how delicious is was!  It had the texture of beef, the flavor was on point, & I felt good eating it! 

My boyfriend was starting to get tired of eating vegan so I suggested this place & so we ordered dinner here and got the burger, beef sandwich, popcorn chicken, & orange chicken.  To his surprise he couldn't believe it was vegan either!  

Obviously there's some slight difference to the taste compared to meat BUT this place has a really good alternative

I absolutely loved the location and the drive thru convenience along with the burger. I have been eating vegan burgers for years and it was delicious. I ordered and the cashier was abrupt with some inaudible words so I pulled up to figure out what's going on. He was walking in circles then finally came to the window and his SHIRT was disgusting. It had so many indistinguishable stains it actually turned my stomach. I felt like I wanted to leave but didn't and was grateful because the food was so great. No one offered to upsell me the sauces so I asked what the flavors are and bought a sauce for a quarter and it was so worth it.  I hope they work out the kinks and can only get better. I would beg for the menu to get on My Fitness Pal so we can track our food and tell us what the ingredients are so we can not miss our diets.

Oh my Buddha.  I don't know how someone can say that the burgers are bland.  It was so good!  I wanted to just keep eating it.  I got curly fries and a single burger.  The curly fries were AMAZEBALLS.  The burger made me so happy.  I love how they're next to my hair salon.  It was meant to be.  -tear drop-  

I'm so excited to try their other items!

So, so gross. I purchased a Groupon and completely regretted wasting the $8, even though it was at a discount. Food was extremely bland. I asked what  the sugar content was in the milkshakes and she told me they did not have any nutritional information, which is absurd. I felt gross after eating here. Fries extremely greasy. Chocolate milkshake not tasty at all. Burger thrown together. No ketchup given on my "to go" order. Very, very disappointing.

I got a double burger and curly fries. This was the best fast food style veggie burger I've had. Very delicious and satiating. A whole lot better than the burger at The Wynn. 

Fries were fries. Chocolate shake was fine. It tasted kind of like a Wendy's frosty. Icy and not really creamy. 

Free self-serve pickle slices.
The food was good but it was also to greasy. Sadly it wasn't good enough for me to return, but the staff was super friendly.

My husband is wanting to try the Vegan diet for 6 months.  He found this place on FB actually.  Then I came on here to check the reviews on here to check out the menu and hoping to find more information on what's in their ingredients.  I thought there was a little hope with the signs posted saying if you have any food allergic, please inform them.  I know I can't eat at a lot of vegan, vegetarian place because they are soy and nuts central.  I don't think my husband thinks of it like that besides no meat and healthy diet.  I told them, I'm highly allergic to soy and nuts.  I asked the guy at the counter if it's safe to eat the soy free burger with my allergy.  He's not sure and asked someone else.  The girl gave me a really vague response.  I should be ok, but we have signs up to say you should be careful eating our food.  We don't add nuts in anything, but some of the food does have almond milk in the sauce or part of the recipe.  I personally know 80% of all buns has soy in it unless the make sure they an order somewhere for no soy buns or make it themselves without soy.  They're not sure themselves.  Then my next question is, what oil do they use?  The guy said soybean oil.  How do they make a soy free burger with soy?  It's possible they use their soybean oil for the patties and they might have soy in their buns.  They're not 100% sure.  I didn't end up eating anything here, since I don't want to have an allergic reaction to the food.  I did insist my husband to still try out the food, if he does like it, I can just do a drive thru pick up for him.  He go the double vegan burger with curly fries and drink for $10.71 tax included.  He said the curly fries were good.  The burger itself had no taste, it was very bland.  It's like eating buns with an omelette without any seasoning.  He did add their mayo sauce to it.  

I personally don't think it's super healthy spot, it's like In-n-Out minus the meat.  Super unhealthy fried food.  

We sat inside the restaurant and it's not ventilated...super greasy, oil feeling, our clothes smelt like oil when we got home.  Plus it smells like sewer in here.  They need to do something about the awful sewer smell. 

This isn't for us.

It's apparent the owner of this restaurant is a tight-fisted business man and not a real vegetarian chef or pioneer for healthy foods - as it tastes like they put the lowest quality ingredients they can acquire into their food. And I could see sitting in the dining area into the back of the kitchen some real junky, bulk-style food ingredients you might get at Food-4-Less, the cheapest stuff you can get. And the food was awful. Bland, flavorless... it was a chore to finish our order. And we tried out their other restaurant, Veggie House, and it too was more of the same. I took some non-vegetarians there to open their palates to new, delicious, meat-less foods while we were visiting in Las Vegas - but we were all sorely disappointed. And it doesn't make sense that Veggie House doesn't cook with garlic or onions (a strict Buddhist dietary code), however VegeWay did. So it begs the question: what exactly are this owner's ethics? Is he actually just trying to save money with garlic and onions at the other restaurant? It appears so. Just cheap cheap cheap.... that's what their food is. Not cheap in price - but cheap in quality, taste, and ethics.

I wanted to give 3.5 stars to this place. I got the burger and vegan fish taco. Burger was good, taco average. Overall, the food and flavors did not stand out, as if something was missing. I may return because of the price ($10 for lunch) and distance from my office, otherwise I would not go out of my way for this.

Ever since I tried this place, I've been craving eating here so often.

Double vegan cheeseburger is around $5 and super filling and delicious. I love the soft bun they use. The patty is a bit chewy with a tapioca or rice texture and even though it's not similar to meat in any way, it still taste really good. It's good in a different way! Lol
I love the sauce. It makes the burger even better. 


Their milk shakes are pretty good, just a little pricey at $5 for what im guessing is 12oz cup. I can make the same thing at home for much less.

My new addiction! LOVE the quick, fast food style approach. Ample seating and parking, and very clean. So far...I've tried the vegan burger(I give it a solid A), the chicken wrap(A+++), and the beef sandwich(A++).

The food is exactly what is expected from a fast food place. I ordered the vegan burger with curly fries and a strawberry smoothie. The burger was good, but a little too greasy for my liking. The fries were crispy. I really enjoyed them. The strawberry smoothie was very sweet but still satisfying. However, next time I order a smoothie I will be asking for less sugar. I can't wait to try other options from the menu. I recommend VegeWay for those looking for a quick bite to eat.

It's pretty good, I want to come back to try it again. Is it the same as animal meat? No, but much of the same sensation of eating burgers is there. I wasn't too impressed by the French fries and think that could help make it better overall. I will be back again

I love their curly fries and nuggets
I haven't tried the burgers but I know they serve vegan so I will expect the flavor to be bland. I've been a vegan for 4 years and it's a challenge to find a restaurant that serves one so I am glad that one exist here in Vegas that is like a fast food. I always support local businesses and I love that this one has a drive thru.

Part two of trying all the Vegan places in town for the daughter. 

Coming here to Chef Kenny's place was an exciting event. A couple of things off the bat, "Turn the MUSIC down."  And where are all the chairs and tables?

I have to review this as a fast food place, and not just a vegan place. 

1. Choices - The choices are similar to any fast food place, burgers, double burgers, burger meal deals, popcorn chicken.  There were sweet potato fries and curly fries as well as milkshakes.  Really interesting was the fish taco, a beef sandwich something like a Bahn Mi and a chicken wrap! Heck, you can even buy frozen patties to bring home... That is great. 

2.  If you are- having a hankering for fast food, a burger, fries and a shake, this is a great place to come and get your fix!

3.  If you are - not only a vegan, but watching what ingredients you are putting into your body, then I would caution you that this is first and foremost a fast food place.  Fried, deep fried, heinz ketchup (vegan, but with corn syrup....) and so all the ingredients are well, as normal as you can get for a vegan.

For me, i think that having fast food and being vegan, this is a great choice.  However, I would say, as a place to go and have a great meal, this would not be my first, second or third choice.  I found the music over bearing, the decor a bit trashy and really not too thoughtful, a lack of chairs and tables, I thought the service was a bit slow, the sweet potatoes way over cooked, and the curly fries were okay.  The chocolate shake was pretty good. The hamburger was very, very cheesy, and overly cheesy.  The fish tacos were pretty darn good.

I just did not feel that this was a place I will continue to eat at. However, when the vegan daughter has a need for greasy, junk food, I am gonna take her here and be proud of it. GK says check it out, just be aware like most fast food places, it is what it is.  This place was to me the equivalent of a McDonalds or Burger King and has a way to go for that In and Out type of quality, taste and ambiance.

Thanks,

Long story short, VegeWay delivers exactly what is promised: vegan fast food.

I love love LOVE when new vegan restaurants open up! It made me even more happy to see a line around the corner for their drive thru on opening day. While I usually don't like when vegan spots use soy to replace everything meat-like (yes, soy is in everything here), I had to give this place a try. I tried their fish tacos and a burger. I thoroughly enjoyed all the toppings on the taco, and the "fish" did taste exactly like fish to me. When the burger came out, I was a little disappointed that I didn't get any lettuce or tomato. I told the cashier, "I ordered mine with everything." He then lifted the bun to show me that, indeed, there was a thin slice of tomato and a little piece of lettuce inside my burger. I was then reminded that this is fast food. If this were a nice sit down restaurant, I would have had a problem with this. You cannot go to this place and expect great restaurant quality meals. Do not go to this place and expect healthy vegan meals either. Vegeway is fast food, as it advertises itself to be. 

That may or may not be your cup of tea, but the concept is fantastic! Vegeway is a vegan restaurant that is clearly unhealthy; however, I would much rather have people eat unhealthy plant based food than unhealthy animal based food. This place is a great way for non-vegans/meat-lovers/fast food goers to incorporate some less damaging veganism into their lives!

And for my new Happy place!
Vege-Way, located in China Town. A woman told me about this place and gave rave reviews! I chose not to look at any reviews or any ratings because I wanted to have a purely unbiased opinion. 

The 100% vegan version of In & Out Burger but 10 times Better! I ordered the strawberry milkshake, chicken nuggets, curly fries, zucchini, and double burger. From the first bite into the burger to the last swallow of the shake, it was vegan heaven. 

The employees were very friendly, the music and ambience was fantastic. Me and my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed our experience in every way possible as customers. 

Not only is this place beyond amazing, the prices make it easy on the pockets so you can fully enjoy your burgers and fries. Oops! and did I mention the DRIVE-THRU?! It just keeps getting better. I highly recommend visiting Vege-Way and be sure to watch the recommended videos about the meat industry. 

I'd definitely LOVE to visit this place again!
Best fast vegan food I've ever had. Sweet potato fries were cooked right. Burger reminded me of in n out. The peppermint oreo shake couldn't fail. The staff were very friendly too.
Good food. They need to add brown/white rice options for sides. A little pricey for serving size. To much oil.
I wanted to go back in and get another burger it was so good.  Also ate the orange chicken and it was soft and tender.  I will be  back for sure.

This was my first time trying a vegan burger and I was shocked at how much I liked it! The only thing I didn't care for was the cheese but it wasn't horrible just different. The service was fast and the prices were reasonable especially for a vegan restaurant. I would most definitely be returning to try other items on the menu! I'm looking forward to trying their "milk"shakes next!

I give very few 5-star reviews, but this place definitely deserves one -- excellent vegan food served drive-thru or at the counter with indoor seating, friendly service, all at a very reasonable, actually inexpensive price!

I arrived around 7:45PM on a Wednesday, 2 days after their soft opening & 2 days before their official grand opening.  The drive-thru was busy, and there were a lot of customers inside, but the wait in-line was brief & the counter staff was very friendly.

I ordered a Double burger meal, so that came with fries (I chose curly) & a soft drink -- all for about $10!  

A small table had become available after I ordered, so I sat down after filing my cup with Dr Pepper, & waited for my order # to be called.  It took about 10 minutes -- very reasonable based on how busy the place was.

I added ketchup & mustard, refilled my drink with Raspberry Iced Tea & sat down to enjoy the meal.

I've been a vegetarian for almost 30 years, having all sorts of vegetarian & vegan burgers over the decades.   Some people prefer the type that do have similar consistency & flavor of beef, some prefer those made more of a mix of vegetable products & that don't really have the flavor of beef.    I tend to fall into the former category, and the burger was absolutely phenomenal!  The only downside is that it was pretty messy to eat -- the (vegan) cheese product made the two vegan meat patties slip & slide.

The fries were good but nothing all that special, and I learned the hard way that the Raspberry iced tea machine needs to be calibrated better, as the liquid product barely had tea or raspberry flavors (compared to the identical machine at other places).

After wolfing down my food, I was in a feeding frenzy.   I wanted another burger.   Turns out the guys at the table next to me were thinking the same thing.   It's not because there wasn't enough food in our initial orders, it was because the burgers tasted so good!

I ended up getting two more double burgers to go, & brought them home.    It's very tempting to eat one right now at 3:30AM but I'm fighting the temptation.   Even with two Double burgers in my refrigerator, I'm somewhat planning on my return trip to VegeWay.      For better or worse, it's on the opposite side of LV from me & in an area that I just haven't had a need to be in often.

But the food/price at VegeWay is so nice that unlike most other restaurants, this place will be a destination for me & I expect to be a frequent customer.

If you're a vegetarian/vegan that tries to avoid food that has the texture & flavor of meat & poultry, you don't have a need to try VegeWay.  Otherwise though, you should definitely try it.  Even if you're not a vegan/vegetarian, you should give their food a try if you're curious.   

On a future visit, I'll give some of their other products a try.

Obviously, as a vegan restaurant, the clientele is rather limited.  However, there are enough of us in the LV area to keep this place fairly busy, even after the newness  wears off.     

Think of it kind of like an In & Out Burger place for vegans & vegetarians -- comparatively inexpensive, flavorful food & friendly, intelligent staff.  The drive-thru lines can get kind of long & the strip mall parking lot isn't really set-up for long drive-they lines.   Also the interior seating area is kind of small, so especially at prime-time lunch & dinner hours, the place may be crowded, however based on my experience last night, the wait isn't bad, & very much worth it.

They do have wifi for customers, but it's secured so I guess you have to ask for the password (it wasn't posted).

The only negative thing I can think of is that the vegan milkshakes looked kind of small for the $5 price, but maybe that's just me being a cheapskate.

There are plenty of nice, expensive vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Vegas, but the only place I know for sure I'll show-off to my vegan & vegetarian friends that come to town will be VegeWay, & I'd love to have my carnivore friends give it a try too.

When your friend asks you to try vegetarian in and out.. And you give it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised at this cute little fast food restaurant. They sell more than just burgers. Menu also includes vegan fish tacos and vegetarian popcorn chicken. 

I tried the single party burger. Guac is free!!  Comes with the burger. However, it tastes like store bought Guac which I don't like instead of fresh made Guac. I think next time I'll go without it. We also got the curly fries, popcorn chicken and a mango milkshake. The mango milkshake is interesting.. It sort of tasted like a mango slushee in boba stores. The curly fries were good. Not as addicting like jack in the box ones but I'm sure these are 100x more healthy. 

My fave was the popcorn chicken. It's just fried gluten but it was very satisfying. Had a nice texture and crispness to it. The burger was good. It didn't exactly taste like in and out but the essence was there. The patty is very crispy and deep fried and does have a bite to it. After the meal I was thoroughly full and didn't miss meat!

The Burger, a slightly new taste to a classic sandwich. The toasted bun and crisp iceberg helped make this sandwich a close In-N-Out comparison. Perhaps they could have grilled the onions to make the burger a little more appealing to the taste. The raw white onion over powered the burger just a bit. The cheese resembled the classic American cheddar after being melted over a how patty, but it didn't fool me. Overall though, it was a solid plant based burger hat I wouldn't mind having again.

Omg this place is FANTASTIC. 

I've had the popcorn "chicken", burger, fish tacos, and curly fries here. I come here about twice a week and thank the lord they have a drive thru.

Everything tastes fantastic.... Even the vegan ranch and buffalo sauce. I was skeptical because it looks and tastes better than meat... But it isn't!!!! This place is incredible.

The staff here are so awesome and friendly. I can tell they love their jobs because they're always peppy and have a smile on their face. 

The prices are reasonable too. Comparable to typical fast food prices. Vegeway keeps my wallet happy because typical vegan places literally rob me.  I'm curious about their nutrition facts but I don't really care because their food is delicious.... I will be back!!!!

I so badly want to love this place, two stars because it is vegan and in a pinch I will return again I'm sure. Second trip here... On the first trip shortly after they very first opened I explain to them that I needed something without soy several employees assured me what I ordered was soy free... Long story short it was not! Second visit here... No cars in front of me and the wait for a burger, fries and milk shake was so long my poor toddler literally Peed his pants in the car. After giving my food and making it clear that I was ready to go on my way I asked what about the milkshake? The kid at the drive-through with absolutely no personality or people skills said oh they're still making it close the window and took his sweet time walking over to what I could clearly see was him in fact making the milkshake. (This was after stopping and chatting for a bit with another employee). Several minutes later....Which even after over 10 minutes of waiting on my food hadn't even been started yet but "they were making it ". Hey I think I'll try the other location... This place needs to seriously step up who it hires! If you want to appeal to vegans, that means people who care about the planet. People. Animals. And what's in their food...please HIRE BETTER STAFF!

The place itself felt like a cheap, greasy fast food joint. Not something you would expect from a Vegan place. The cheeseburger left a really disgusting taste in my mouth. It was over cooked. If you want battered zucchini soaked in oil-they've got it! I don't be returning.
Fast food at its best for Vegan eats! The food has definitely improved over the last year with new additions to their menu & possibly a change to their burger? Either way very good.

My vegan friend was super stoked about this place opening and demanded we check it out asap.
Overall, pretty impressed with the taste and quality of food, despite it being a fast food joint. We just ordered the burgers, but theres also tacos and other shinanigans on the menu. Fried zucchini is on point, highly recommend.
Also, their vegan milkshakes are bomb, the strawberry one gives me life. I wish I ordered like 8 of them.

It's so hard to like a vegan burger, but hey they tried. Taste wise it's not bad and it is the best thing on the menu, but still not a fan. In no way am I a vegan, but like to eat less red meat when I can. 

If it's your first time, try the burger meal. Stay away from the vegan chicken nuggets. I've had it twice and it's bland and oily. 

Their cilantro salad is tasty and is similar to the one I tried at Veggie House. 

I love that they conveniently have a drive thru. Workers are always friendly too!

Vegeway has many of the quality trademarks one would expect from the chef of Veggie House, one of Las Vegas best Vegan restaurants. The food is delicious, which is terrific news for any and all vegetarians and vegans looking for a casual bite. That the new place has a drive thru is also good news, and rather unique for a place like this. I would recommend this burger joint to anyone, even though I myself prefer the "beef" sandwich to the burgers. Another stand out  here are the wonderful milkshakes. Do yourself a favor and try them.

I must say that the location itself could use some improving though. There are few tables, all of them small, and it is utterly uninviting the way they have set it up. They all but encourage you to just use the drive thru or place your order to go on account of the poor interior. It may look new but the floorplan is doing them no service here.

Being a vegan in Las Vegas, you know there is not a huge list of restaurants! Chef Kenny has come to the rescue with VegeWay and VeggieHouse! 
I got the popcorn chicken with sweet potato fries and a chocolate milkshake and I give it a 5/5. The only reason I'm giving Vegehouse 4/5 stars is because my girlfriend got a cheeseburger and we're really not fans of the Daya American Cheese. It has a very sweet aftertaste. It would be amazing if VegeWay found an alternative cheese.
Other than that, this place is so cute, has great food and kind service. It's fast food but doesn't have the grimy feel that Burger King and those places have. 
Even if you're not vegan/vegetarian, check it out! I'm so happy vegan is spreading across Vegas!

Hi Yelpers. I recently took the trip to VegeWay's Centennial's location. I cannot comment on the décor of the inside, I decided on the drive-thru. I decided to go with three stars on this review, so bare with me and I will explain why. For starters, let me begin by stating for the record, that I was somewhat mislead by the "name" and with that the trouble began.  

So let me begin with the food was okay, not the best I've ever had and certainly not the worst I've ever had. I realized very quickly that I wasn't eating from a traditional "vegetarian restaurant", but more so a restaurant that specialized in "meatless options". Two completely different types of establishments. This place in my option is for meat eaters who want to take a break from eating meat once in awhile. 

My order: 
I ordered the double cheese burger combo, and upgraded to the sweet potato fries and a strawberry tea. The burger was good, and fries were hot and the tea was good. The smell was amazing and I couldn't wait to get my food home to take a bite. During the ride back home, I reached in and grabbed a few fries and they were slathered in "GREASE". Now, I realize that they had to cook the fries which involves frying them, but I could taste the grease and had to blot out the fries. Once I arrived home, I open the meal and dumped the fries out on paper towel to save my save the trouble of blotting the fries one by one. Overall, the burger was good but it also dripped oil and was quite messy. I realized quickly that it wasn't worth spending $12 bucks for a meatless greasy burger, fake cheese and greasy fries. I didn't feel healthy at all, I ended up with a stomach ache. 

The review is a honest one, which is my opinion. I would urge everyone to go and try this place. I was impressed with the taste of the meatless burger, and for that reason I gave the place "3 stars" but for anyone who watches what they eat like I do and cares about their caloric intake skip what I had and maybe go with another menu option. I'll pass since I limit my consumption of fried foods, but to each their own.

Meh. That's all I can say. I saw the reviews and wanted to give it a try. I went through the drive thru (which is pretty cool for a place that sells healthy food), but I will admit I was underwhelmed at the double and my wife said the single was Meh too. Don't get me wrong, I like the concept and maybe other things on the menu are better, but not what we got. 

Redeeming grace though are the curly fries. Curly fries make anything better and they at least did them right.

Work on your veggie burger though.

I give it 3 out of 4 plus an extra star just for being vegan. My boyfriend and I are big fans of veggie house so we were excited to find out vegeway is their sister property. I got a burger strawberry milkshake and zucchini fries. Zucchini fries not worth the money. Burger was ok. Wouldn't order it again tho. Strawberry milk shake was delicious. Taste just like the real thing. Excited to try fish tacos next time.

I really enjoy the food here but EVERY time.. seriously 4 our of 4!! There is an issue with my order. 
1) Wrong food all together.

2) Left out nuggets had to drive back 

3) Forgot to put in monster fries because I confused him the kid told me. 

4) Waited 20 min for my burger because their printer is not working and none of the 5 employees realized I hadn't been served even though there were only 3 people in the restaurant.

I wish the service here wasn't so poor cause I'd like to come back

Vegeway has to be the most uptight place I have ever been to about ranch. When this place first opened rach was unlimited, I was never asked to pay extra for ranch. After a few months of them being open you got one ranch with ever order and 25 cents for extra ranch, I just went here and now you have to pay 25 cents for every ranch, kind of silly. Very good food though. But the inside could be designed so much better, it just looks really run down inside. Four starts because of the inside and the ranch thing blows my mind .

Since moving to the West Coast from
New York, I've been confronted by all the In-N-Outs, and weeping vegetarian FOMO tears.

Enter the next best thing: a crispy, meaty veggie patty (actually, make that a double) stacked with crisp lettuce and tomatoes, squeezed between a toasted bun with a just a schmear of guac (free but you have to request it). I brought my omnivorous roommate here for his first ever vegan burger and even he was impressed.

I'm normally not a fan of Daiya cheese, which has its own not-quite-cheese flavor to it. In the burger however, it just works. It does stick to your teeth a little, but worth a little flossing for the flavor it adds.

Official prognosis: best vegan fast food burger I've ever had. I definitely see myself becoming a regular.

Low prices. Average quality. It may be Vegan/Plant-Based but some of the food doesn't sit well in my stomach, compared to vegan food at other places like VeggyStreet or Panacea. However, I love the convenience of drive-thru... and their turmeric sauce is very good.
Wow!! I'm blown away, Best vegan burger in town for sure. Can't wait to try everything on the menu.
A+ Vegan fastfood. Great in house burgers, an awesome Mac sauce, good chicken nuggets, a nice owner. I'd like to see more of these around.
I had the Vegan Double Burger and sweet potato fries and was extremely satisfied. Great taste and will need to come back to try the fish burger. All in all, great food and will come back again.

I was really excited about a fast food vegan place...but disappointed after trying it out. I had high hopes for Chef Kenny because his Veggie House is amazing! This is okay if you're looking for something quick, but I probably won't return. We gave it a few tries and tried multiple items...fish sandwich probably the best. Try it out though and see for yourself.
The Hawaiian burger was yummy and the regular fries were delicious. The cheeseburger was good, the sweet potato fries were kind of bland however. The service was friendly but a little slow.

Not only was the food great, the serviced I received from the lady that answered the phone (and my NUMEROUS questions) to the Manager that helped me with a completely wrong order (ordered through a 3rd party, not vegeways fault) was nothing short of impeccable. I know we don't all have the same experiences but they definitely made my day and helped me beyond measure. 

The monster fries were to die for, popcorn chicken  and the spicy jalapeño burger was . I will definitely be back, not just because the food was great but the customer service . 

Thank vegeway for taking care of me and making it right.
Stopped by for the soft opening to try their cheeseburger. It's hard to find a good veggie burger in Vegas and this is exactly what I was looking for! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

It was ok. I'm not a strict vegetarian, but I'm not a big meat eater either. Veggie burgers/parties are right up my alley. Bubs and I both got the Hawaiian burger, and though it was pretty flavorful the texture of the patty was mushy. Every bite felt almost like veggie paste that got stuck to the roof of your mouth. If they were more dense then it probably would have been more enjoyable. They didn't taste like meat which I kind of liked (Bubs did not). We also got the side of fried zucchini. Lightly battered and thick pieces, but no flavor. For the price I wasn't satisfied, but if I'm in the area I might give them another try.
Yummmm very good!! I will definitely be back! I got the chicken jalapeno basil sandwich combo everything was fresh and delicious first time eating bacon fast food

Cautious carnivores...
Disclosure: I'm not Vegan, nor a vegetarian.  
So, I've been acquainted with vegan places, as well as vegetarian.  I've also have encountered places which state Vegan, yet they make use of eggs & have the animal renet in some of their ingredients- not vegan. 
Clean establishment, friendly staff and it has a drive thru!
I've been to VegeWay five times- I've made more use of the driverthru:)  
VegeWay's fried zucchini and the Vegan milkshake are my favorites. That milkshake is yummy! I've built a vegan burger and it was tasty! I mean the mock meat actually tasted really good.   I'm not a chicken person, so as for the VegeWay's orange and popcorn dishes I can't honestly tell you.  However! I've seen those plates pass my by and thought hmm- next time. I wish the menu was a bit more extensive, perhaps a Vegan infused menu?
Double cheeseburger fries and a vanilla shake please.!!   Thank you Kenny for making another vegan staple in Las Vegas.

First time in there today, taste great fair price, cool service, would definitely recommend 
Good job guys!!

Been here twice and the food was delicious! First time was inside the second was drive-thru! I always get a vegan burger, curly fires and a chocolate shake. Perfect for everyone, even meat-eaters! Good till the last bite!

Stopped by here for lunch, not realizing it was their grand opening weekend. There was a line, but they took orders quickly. We got their double vegan burgers with curly fries and a side of popcorn chicken. We waited a while for our food. We didn't realize our order was already ready because the girl putting together our orders did not call out the right number. The popcorn chicken looked better in the picture than it tasted, but their vegan burgers were good. The vegan patty is probably one of the best ones we have had in town, since most restaurants use the boca burger, which I hate. They sell their vegan burgers frozen, so we will plan on going back there to buy some and make our own burgers at home!
I would like to go back there again to try the tacos, salad, and wrap.
I gave them 4 stars because they were disorganized and understaffed, given that they should have ramped up for the grand opening. Also, it bothered me that the girl preparing the orders did not have her hair up.

Very disappointed with my current visit to vegeway. I went to the drivethru and that was the initial issue. Their order speaker is old so I couldn't get my order taken properly so I had to get to the window to fix my order than I was told they didn't have a sweet potato fries but shows you can order them off the app. I'm glad I didn't place an order ahead of time because I would've been even more upset. So I ordered curly fries and my double vegan burger. I get my order after being told to wait on the side because the person behind me their order was ready before mine. And when I get my order my curly fries aren't that they're fries that are curved. Not even whole curly fries. Just a lot of nonsense and dissatisfaction with this stop at vegeway. And this is all without even trying my burger yet

I waited 40 minutes in the drive through only for them to forget the cheese and pickles on my burger, at that point I didn't even figure it was worth going back to ask where the cheese was. I ordered a milk shake (five stars), fish tacos (five stars), curly fries, double vegan burger, and chicken wrap. The burger tasted like egg foo young but less eggy and the consistency was amazing. The chicken wrap should have just been marketed as an avocado wrap because that's all I could taste. The fish tacos seem to be the best thing on the menu but they were slightly watery, the flavor profile was delicious. I gave it three stars because customer service was subpar and the food wasn't the best I'd had when it came to vegan/veg options. I'd say that aside from Shake Shacks mushroom burger that this place provides the best healthy lifestyle alternatives to eating meat. I just wish the customer service was better.

I really like the burgers here.  I've tried some of the other dishes - the beef sandwich, the chicken sandwich, and the popcorn chicken, but the burger is what I crave.  It's slightly crispy, as if fried.  Also a fan of Chef Kenny's other restaurant,  Veggie House.

Amazing! We tried the burger, popcorn chicken, and sweet potato fries. The fry sauce was unexpected and had a little kick to it. The burger was amazing! It comes in a bun with cheese, patty, lettuce, onion, and tomato. There is also a slightly sweet sauce. The popcorn chicken was my next favorite. It comes with a tartar sauce and it is cooked to perfection. The sweet potato fries were good in flavor but weren't crispy. That was a little miss for me. I will absolutely be back! Please open one in Henderson.

Only issue: they are ALWAYS out of milkshakes!!!! I love to enjoy one once a week but usually they are out of the flavoring and "only have vanilla."  And today, they were out of ice cream because it "all gone bad so we cannot use it." 

I'm sorry. But it's over 90 degrees out and almost summer. Get it together. If only their shake game was as good as their food game.

Very yummy! Great service also, they added avocado FOR FREE lol and grilled onion! Other places would charge extra. It's definitely the little things. They also provide this sauce that's kind of like a spread, it's really good (:

My fiancé and I recently moved into this part of town and I was dying to try VegWay. Their menu is an interesting selection of in-n-out type burgers, as well as orange chicken, curly fries and salads. I got the single burger with monster fries and my fiancé got a double burger with curly fries. My burger was good but my fiancé and I both decided that the patty was very plain. It didn't taste seasoned or anything, but that's not to say it was bad. The monster fries were definitely too much for me. The vegan cheese didn't really melt and I could see the oil residue sitting at the bottom of the container. I stopped about halfway through because the fries were just drenched in oil. 
We will be back just because it is close and I want to give them another shot on their other items. I know they've only been open for a year but they have potential! I wish I could give them a 3.5, but unfortunately Yelp doesn't let me.

Me being a meat eater I was curious to see how a vegan burger would stack up.

I ordered the:

Vegan Burger - Honestly really surprised me with the flavor, had some char to it and was done well, however it doesn't really fill you up and the price point for a vegetarian product is pretty high ($4.69 for a burger that doesn't fill you up).

Curly Fries - ehhhh not bad not good just fries...

Zucchini Sticks - Ok not the best but def not the worst

Milkshake - Again not the best but def not the worst...

OVerall the prce point of everything that I got would have equated to three #1's at In-N-Out...while the burger was intresting and flavorful I can not warrant a strong recomendation at that price point. Being a vegan must be super expensive...

So I've tried VegeWay twice now and once through the drive-thru which isn't what I would prefer since you should be eating these meals right when they make them. By the time I ate my first meal it was soggy and not really fresh so I couldn't enjoy it. I ordered a regular burger & curly fries. The second time I came, I brought a friend and we ordered orange chicken, Hawaiian burger and curly fries. The orange chicken was totally different, but you wish you could add a side of rice to make it go together like a rice bowl instead of on a fries tray. The Hawaiian burger was amazing and fresh so all the juices mixed well together with every bite! 

Would definitely recommend if you want to try vegetarian/vegan options, but not in a healthy way.

In my opinion, I feel like vegeway was like any other typical fast food place but just vegan. The service was super mediocre which I expect since it's fast food and it's super casual. I got the burger and curly fries and some people say you can't taste the difference but I definitely tasted the difference from the patty. Which is not a bad thing. Overall, it's a good fast food joint if you want something vegan.

Initially upon arriving, we thought the food was decent. First few bites were delicious. The more we ate of our burgers though, the worse the meal seemed to taste. Next couple days, 2/3 of us felt incredibly sick to our stomachs and had some serious allergic reactions. We had contacted then for ingredients to our food with a promise to receive an email within 48 hours, but the email never arrived. As someone who eats healthy vegan 24/7, this is not the way to go. Vegan does not mean healthy, and it shows.
My favorite place to grab a quick vegan burger, fries & a shake! Chef Kenny is amazing at everything he does!

Friendly staff, drive-thru, vegan food! This place is great! My sister is pregnant  and was really craving a cheese burger but gave up meat and dairy. We both decided to finally try this place and it was worth it! We had a great experience. My sister absolutely loved the double vegan cheeseburger. She said it tastes like In-N-Out burgers. But better. I let her try my fish taco and she ended eating the whole thing "omg. I could live off these tacos and burgers" she said. With a thumbs up. My 2 year old nephew loved the popcorn chicken and sweet potato fries. I wish we had more places like these. I saw the owner walk around talking to the other customers. Everyone's so friendly here. Food was quick. And prices weren't so bad either. Try this place. Take your "carnivore" friends I'm sure they'll love it too.

While this place was just ok, I don't really understand the great reviews. There is a lot of competition for vegan food in Vegas and this was one of the many we tried. There are others that are better, better for you and have way more options. Google it.
Drove by and saw this place and felt hungry all of a sudden. Very good choice. Small menu but well executed. Good food. I'll try to come back before I move out of state.

The fact that I have gone here twice in a row for the past 3 days as I write this review probably says a lot about how much I have come to appreciate Vegeway.

Initially when they first opened, I absolutely hated their burgers and vowed to never come back after my first try - the "cheese" made me lose my appetite for it made the burger taste too sweet for my liking and just made me want to find the nearest In-N-Out as quick as possible. 

Fast forward to half a year later and becoming vegan for almost 5 months, my palate has definitely changed (or the establishment has gotten better since they opened) and I was very impressed after trying the Hawaiian Burger - super tasty, juicy, onions were caramelized nicely - and the Beef Bahn Mi sandwich. The next day we came back to try the Double Vegan Burger and the chicken burger (but they mistakingly gave us the single vegan burger instead - but I guess shame on us for not double checking our drive thru order). We seriously felt like we were eating an In-N-Out burger which has officially fulfilled our craving since becoming vegan! 

Prices are honestly pretty steep (prepare to spend almost $20+ on fast food but hey, this ain't no McDonald's & you do get what you pay for!). I do appreciate the various choices such as wraps, salad, popcorn chicken, etc. if you're not feeling up for burgers. 

Overall, a must try if you're in the mood for a plant based alternative to your Big Mac and fries. Thanks to Chef Kenny for another delicious vegan creation!

We came here last night right before they closed. They were still busy and happy to serve last minute customers. 

Menu is very simple and short. We ordered a single cheeseburger, a double cheese burger combo with sweet potato fries, chicken turmeric salad, and a chocolate shake. Everything taste great! The burgers has vegan thousand island sauce that makes it so flavorful and delicious. I personally was IN LOVE with their vegan milkshake! I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors.

The first thing I had here was the burger and the curly fries and it was amazing! I could not believe it was vegan, totally fooled me! I managed to come a second time (drive thru) and I got the burger again and decided to get a mango milkshake. The burger I scarfed down on the drive home but the mango milkshake not so much. I actually ended up tossing it :( It was wayyyy too sweet and didn't taste anything like mangos. It honestly tasted like cardboard. I think maybe the other flavors will be better. Either way, I'll still come here again, that burger is too die for!!

Really happy to have been told about VegeWay. Good service, good food, affordable. I'd recommend it. 

It's a burger joint, so I'm not sure why someone made a comment about a ton of grease, what did they expect with burgers and fries? It goes with the territory.

I've only had the veggie burger here and I'm a bit on the fence about it. It's nothing extraordinary but I sometimes randomly crave for it. The burger has a nice crunch texture then a gooeyness on the inside that ends up sticking to your teeth.

I'm so sad because I love this place. On my third visit here I noticed (for a second time) people eating behind the counter where they prepare the food. I mean I know people are going to touch my food but I don't want to see them eating fries and dipping them in sauce while they're getting my stuff ready. Other than that, this is a really fun vegan spot!

It was my first time eating here. The food was good. The only thing I didn't like is the crew blasting music. I like music loud in my car but not blasting while I am eating. Loud yes but not blasting.

Before I came here I heard sooo many different things. Some friends said its great and some said otherwise- I even heard a rumor that they aren't fully vegan. I ended up trying the burger and regular fries and I wasn't amazed. It was bland and I would not get it again but Im definitely willing to come back and try other things on the menu. The concept itself is already great. I really enjoyed the chipotle sauce, the ranch not so much. I also tried my friend's popcorn chikn and I liked it more than my food. I appreciate the diversity of the menu and the location.

Curly fries and the popcorn chicken were excellent. Beef sandwich was decent. I was sad that I didn't have the tastebuds for the cheeseburger (specifically the cheese) though. 

Positive and friendly staff.

Needs more locations!

I did feel a tinge of excitement at the thoughts of a vegan burger...like a fast food place with health in mind.   Even though burgers have been off my radar for  at least 4 years due to my more plant based eating it was fun finding one to eat that actually looked and tasted like an ole time burger.  Good JOB!  You should market these big time.  Location is a bit out of  my way. But I take comfort knowing you ARE 'out there' when I get a craving urge.  I have shared your business information with like minded friends.  We should support forward thinking restaurants.

Obviously this review is overdue because being eating here since the day they open. They say that this  taste like in and out but I honestly tell you they are better and still fast food but healthier.  They are delicious my non vegan husband eat them like they are regulars burgers no complains and they begin adding new items to the menu now they have orange chicken OMG latterly taste like chicken definitely kills the craving of real chicken in the wraps are really good, the fish tacos too, the only thing I never taste are the shakes but I hear they're really good . So far I can assure you, you will find something to eat here.  it doesn't matter if you vegan or not don't be scare give it a try.

Good news- 100% vegan!  Fast food!  Taste good!

Other news-  A ton of grease.  Soybean oil to be exact.  Don't go here if you are avoiding oils, soy, sugars, Gmos, or fried food.  There will be limited options.  

That being said it is still fast food, people!  Don't set your expectations and high and they will be exceeded!!

Unfortunately it's a little too much for my belly more than once in a blue moon.  Great concept, friendly workers, quick, and cheap.

I am not a vegetarian or vegan and I love this place! Yes there are things on the menu that are not my favorite but there is nothing I would not eat there. The fact that there is a place to pick up a quick bite to eat, on the go, and not be a meat protein based, is awesome. Some other reviewers complain that it's not healthy, but what fast food restaurant is, if you want healthy you should hit up a salad bar or smoothie place.
Ordered burger meal thru uber eats. The patty was bland and tasted like cabbage. The sauce is way too sweet and was glopped on. The buns were soggy. Only decent thing was the curly fries.

Chef Kenny has really outdone himself !!! Cruelty free, clean food from a DRIVE THRU !! The quality and taste is phenomenal. The burger & popcorn chicken are the stars that I've tried so far. Now I need to work my way through the rest of the menu !! The service was super cheery , especially considering how busy this newly opened hotspot is. This is a great guilt free meal as a treat or if you just don't feel like cooking, I'll be back ! THANK YOU Kenny
Vegan Beef = if you love banh mi, you will love it, vegetarian, vegan or not, its yum.

Tried the regular burger and the Hawaiian burger. Also the monster fries.. everything was pretty good. The Hawaiian burger was a little too sweet for my taste, but when I'm craving something greasy and fast this is my new go to place.

If you're looking for a junk food vegan fix, this is the place to go. Service is fast and the food hits the spot. Nothing like a mouthwatering "double burger" with fries and ranch dressing for dipping. You will experience all the gluttony of a fast food binge but it will be delicious and cruelty free. If you're in a hurry the drive through seemed to move pretty fast.

Horrible place, cruel, disgraceful!

Vegeway South were committed to participate in a national fundraiser for an animal rescue organization on Saturday November 4th, 2017, being promoted for a month long by the charity to almost a million followers. The day before the fundraiser they decide to not do it and told no one they were pulling out. They accepted all that free promotion and advertising for their establishment and never donated a dime. 

Folks, this is not a vegan restaurant but simply a greedy business looking to make a quick buck off people who are compassionate and care for animals. An embarrassment to the word "vegan". I hope they go out of business.

You wouldn't be able to say it doesn't taste like meat cuz it totally does!!! For a vegan who craving for meat texture, this place is ya homerun!! Try the new item, Hawaiian burger if you like a bit of sweetness in your burger!

I love this place so much and in the beginning, everything was always perfect. But for the last couple MONTHS I've been coming, they mess up my order EVERY time. I work in the industry so I understand mess ups here and there but I come here quite frequently and it's very frustrating to have my order corrected EVERY SINGLE time. I have been coming less and less because for me, even if I ordered correctly in the beginning, it's still uncomfortable for me to have my order fixed. It makes me feel like I'm bothering you, and as a customer I should never feel that way. 
I'm sad because I love Chef Kenny and his food. Please hire better staff that pay more attention.
This place takes so long it's rediculous. The food is sub par when weighed with how long it takes

When I first saw someone review this place as a "vegan in n out" I was too excited. So here's the pro: inexpensive. Vegan food is usually pretty costly but this place, you can get out for $10. Cons: we tried the infamous burger...honestly, not the best veggie burger I've had. It didn't have any texture, it mostly tasted like beans and fell apart. The cheese, not great. It had that sticky texture that some vegan cheese has in your mouth. I was not a fan. The fries were good. I thought I'd try the milkshake that everyone raved about. It tasted like a combination of ice and those protein vanilla workout shakes you get. I don't think I'll be coming back for round 2.
Love this place! A bit of a drive but so worth it! Guilt free food with all the flavor!

Ugh. I'm so sad! Drove 15 miles to my sisters house (she lives close to Vegeway) JUST to have some delicious vegan food from this gem. We ordered from uber eats since we had our hands full at the house. We ordered a double burger meal, curly fries, chicken wrap, a milkshake and specified on the order that we wanted ranch with the meal. When our ordered arrived, there was no drink, no fries, no ranch. We tried to call and let them know, no answer. So we had to drive over and pick up the rest of our food. They were nice about the mistake but this ruined the rest of our meal. When we got home, the burger was cold. I love Vegeway and as a vegan, I fully support their mission but guys, make sure you check to-go orders before they leave the restaurant. We paid $32 for a cold and late meal. Ugh. Im so sad, I was looking forward to this meal all week! Ps. Keep the ranch consistent, sometimes it's super runny.

From California, and wow! Popcorn chicken, burger, fries, zucchini, wow so delicious! (didn't eat each order by myself lol it was all shared) 
But i can't wait to try the milkshakes! 
I totally need to own one of these in Orange County California...

Everything is delicious!! We aren't vegan but have been trying new options for our diet because we have been eating unhealthy from the holidays. Let me tell you I LOVed it. Total shock it doesn't taste like fake meat it's all made fresh and the owner Kenny is great he actually cares. He says he coming up with a couple more restaurants for vegan option. I can't wait. The food is filling but light I feel like I put real food in my body even though it's "fast food" it tastes like homemade

LOVE that this place exists! 

It's the only fast food Vegan eatery around
WITH A DRIVE THRU! 

...HELLO!!!!

Such a relief to have this convenience when I'm on this side of town 

Buttttt honestly, I just wish they invested more effort in the quality of their menu items.

I'd pay $1-$3 extra for a nice sturdy bun 
and/or a bigger burger patty to fill me up

My three star rating is not for the food, it is for the customer service. I always order through drive-thru and I have to repeat myself several times and half of the time, they get my order wrong. Also it seems like it's ran by high school students who give attitude. The last trouble I had was the wait time. I ordered two jalapeno burgers  and it must have taken nearly ten minutes. There was no one in front of me so I don't understand why it took so long,  and this isn't the first time it's happened. 
As for the food,  I love the jalapeno burger, fries and popcorn chicken. Have yet to try the shakes!

Dang, this place is really lacking.

My boyfriend and I ordered a cheese burger each and shared curly fries after hearing they weren't currently doing their monster fries. And it was just not good. It wasn't even that the patty wasn't convincing (which it wasn't), it just overall wasn't good in terms of taste, texture, and appeal. Even their curly fries didn't match up to similar fast food chains that their trying to emulate, and neither their sauces. The house made ketchup, v-mac sauce, and chipotle were weak or tasteless. Everything I tried here was just undoubtedly inferior to their non-vegan counterparts. 

I just think this place is trying too hard to be something it's not. I know that's the concept, but the only way I can imagine someone enjoying the food here are vegans who've completely forgotten the taste and texture of meat, cheese, and butter. And it's not because this place is vegan, because this is coming from someone who hasn't eaten meat in almost 3 years and enjoys vegan food. It's just because its just not good in terms of food in general. Plus one star for the friendly service, minus three for one of the worst veggie burgers and, flat out, worst meals I've had in a while. This place doesn't do vegan food justice.

Craving burgers much? I do, but visits to Vegeway minimizes the guilt of diet high in cholesterol while satisfying that craving that is bovine friendly. Even that pair of bovines advocating "Eat Mor Chikin" 20 years ago would be happy about everything served at Vegeway.

So it has been a few months since my last visit to Vegeway, it was cold and slightly breezy (perfect weather for everything except passing the time watching all the hunnies show off what they've been training off-season for) and I dropped in after a Yelp gathering for their limited time holiday inspired milkshake: Peppermint Oreo.  To be honest, it was not what I envisioned but it tasted very good and didn't even last 10 minutes on the drive home.

Fast forward to the dreaded summer heat of early June, I am already not a fan and it is only in the 90s around 11am. I was running some errands, got a little lost driving around and decided to just grab something at Vegeway for brunch, since I was only a mile or two away.

As I was about to walk in, a customer was just coming out and said "they are not opened." I was not expecting that, and although I believed him I still opted to go inside and ask when they are going to be open. Which turned out to be 11am, instead of 10:30am that is posted on Yelp (I have since sent a business update request to YELP HQ), so I just waited the 15 minutes inside and enjoy their AC and check their menu for what I would order later.

I was going to get two Double Vegan Burgers, until I saw the new item being promoted: Hawaiian Cheese Burger. So I order one of each of these burgers, a Chocolate and Vanilla Vegan Milkshake and added Vegan Popcorn Chicken (so I can charge it to my CC, because it would be super embarrassing and a hassle not being able to pay the $2 and change I still owe in cash after using up $14 in Groupon credit.

The Chocolate and Vanilla Milkshake is an easy custom order for them to whip up, and it felt extra refreshing sipping it in the dry heat. Most people probably wouldn't even notice that it is vegan, but it is.

The Hawaiian Cheeseburger comes with a ring shaped pineapple from the can, which was good. But had that pineapple been fresh or just grill it to caramelized the natural sugar inside, it would have made that burger even better.

The Double Vegan Cheeseburger was pretty substantial. Eating it Zi noticed stuff sticking to the roof of my mouth more than when I am having a regular burger, but overall it is enjoyable and I was quickly getting full.

The Popcorn Chicken was decent. The batter reminds me of the ones coating the Sweet and Sour Pork at local Chinese takeouts, which is thicker than I 'd prefer, but not horrible. The dipping sauce that it was served with, I was not a fan of, so I ate most of it at home with the sweet chili sauce often served with Thai BBQ chicken. It was good eating it that way.

Overall, it is a good healthier alternative to just eating meat all the time, and my wait was nearly non-existent and the nice friendly service just made the entire getting-lost-and-that's-how-a-nice-guy-like-me-ended-up-at-a-place-like-this kind of day that much more pleasant. Or the Vegan deity in the sky pulled some cosmic strings and steered me in the door. Either way it was a charming experience and no chikin or cows were hurt to make my visit possible.

Vegeway - ?????????????????????????????

Best vegan burger I've had!! Definitely recommend for vegans and non-vegans. I order the double burger with monster fries. Burger was deliciousssss and the fries weren't really my cup of sauce (pun intended). 

I would also like to thank my mom for sponsoring this meal.

I am so excited that we got to try VegeWay on our trip to Vegas from Chicago. It was refreshing to see the tables full of people enjoying cruelty-free food. My husband got the beef sandwich which was more like a bahn mi sandwich than an italian beef one. I had the burger, fries , and shake. The burger patty was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Very spot on!! The popcorn chicken was amazing- no difference at all to me from my chicken eating days. The milkshake was good, but we have Chicago Diner here which is crazy good. The entire time I was thinking about bringing my kids here as vegetarians the choices on menus are boring and/or abysmal. The salads looked good, but we were on vacation and were eating like fat vegans at food eating contest. Chef Kenny is doing something revolutionary- he's making vegan food fast, approachable, and affordable.

Whether you are vegan or not, it all tastes the same (so yes, the food tasted great). The difference, no animals were harmed in the making of this food.

I got 2 baskets of fries, chicken nuggets and 2 "milk"shakes for $24.

I've been looking forward to this place opening for a few months now. Came today for the soft opening and I was not disappointed! The vegan patty in the burger tasted and felt like real ground beef, which is no surprise coming from the culinary genius, Chef Kenny. The cheese was delicious and oozed from the burger. Even the Dr. Pepper was superb! I wouldn't be surprised if carnivorous patrons came over from the bar next door and thought they were actually eating meat. I'll definitely be back, and highly recommend this place to vegans and meat eaters alike! Let's make it a chain!

The burgers are amazing!!!

Seriously, best veggie burger I have ever had, anywhere. My 17yo meat-eating, In-N-Out loving son just declared, with a surprised look on his face, that it was "better than a regular burger" and demanded that I stop what I was doing and take a bite of mine immediately. 

The vanilla milkshake is also something I will definitely order again. Too bad they sold out of chocolate and strawberry before I could get there tonight, but am so glad to see them so busy.

Can't wait to try everything else. I still have a 'vegan beef sandwich' (looks like a banh mi to me) waiting for me in the kitchen, but I had to sit down right away to send them some love by writing this review after trying that incredibly delicious burger :D
